latest on issue or renewal of the Union inland navigation certificate after 1.1.2045 \n2.                      \nArticle 15.11(3)(a) applies to day-trip vessels\nlaid down on or before 1 April 1976 until the first issue or renewal of the Union\ninland navigation certificate after 1.1.2045, with the proviso that only\npaints, varnishes, coatings and other materials used on surfaces facing escape\nroutes and other materials for the surface treatment of panels must be\nfire-resistant and that smoke or toxic vapours may not develop to any dangerous\nextent.\n3.                      \nArticle 15.11(12) applies to day-trip vessels\nlaid down on or before 1 April 1976 until the first issue or renewal of the Union\ninland navigation certificate after 1.1.2045, with the proviso that it is\nsufficient if, instead of stairs in the form of a load-bearing steel assembly,\nthe stairs serving as an escape route are designed in such a way that they\nremain useable, in the event of a fire, for about the same time as stairs in\nthe form of a load-bearing steel assembly.\nArticle 24.04\nOther derogations\n1.                      \nFor craft the minimum freeboard of which was\ndetermined in accordance with Article 4.04 of the Rhine Vessel Inspection\nRegulation as applicable on 31 March 1983, the inspection body may, at the\nrequest of the owner, determine the freeboard in accordance with Article 4.03\nof the Rhine Vessel Inspection Regulation as applicable on 1 January 1995.\n2.                      \nCraft laid down before 1 July 1983 do not need\nto conform to Chapter 9 of the Rhine Vessel Inspection Regulation, but must at\nleast conform to Chapter 6 of the Rhine Vessel Inspection Regulation as\napplicable on 31 March 1983.\n3.                      \nArticle 15.06(3)(a) to (e), and Article\n15.12(3)(a), with regard to the rule concerning a single hose length, apply\nonly to craft laid down after 30 September 1984, and to conversions of the\nareas concerned, at the latest when the Union inland navigation certificate is\nrenewed after 1 January 2045.\n4.                      \n(left void) \n5.                      \nWhere this provision refers, with regard to\nequipment design requirements, to a European or an international standard, such\nequipment may, after any revision of the standard, continue to be used for a\nfurther 20 years following the revision of the standard.\nArticle 24.05\n(Left void)\nArticle 24.06\nDerogations for craft not\ncovered by Article 24.01\n1.                      \nThe following provisions apply:\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 (a) to craft for which a vessel\ncertificate in accordance with the Rhine Vessel Inspection Regulation was\nissued for the first time between 1 January 1995 and 30 December 2008, provided\nthey were not under construction or undergoing conversion on 31 December 1994;\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 (b) to craft which have obtained\nanother traffic licence between 1 January 1995 and 30 December 2008.\n2.                      \nIt must be proved that those craft comply with\nthe Rhine Vessel Inspection Regulations as applicable on the date on which the\nvessel certificate or the other traffic licence has been granted.\n3.                      \nThe craft must be adapted to comply with\nprovisions which enter into force following the first issue of the vessel\ncertificate or other traffic licence in accordance with the transitional\nprovisions set out in table 3.\n4.                      \nArticle 18(1g) of this Directive and Article\n24.04(5) of this Annex , apply MUTATIS MUTANDIS.\n5.                      \nThe following definitions apply in table 3:\n\u2013                        \n\u00a0\u2018NRC\u2019: The provision does not apply to craft\nwhich are already operating, unless the parts concerned are replaced or\nconverted, i.e. the provision applies only to Newly-built craft and to\nthe Replacement or Conversion of the parts or areas concerned. If\nexisting parts are replaced by replacement parts using the same technology and\nof the same type, this does not constitute replacement (\u2018R\u2019) within the meaning\nof the transitional provisions.\n\u2013                        \n\u2018Issue or renewal of the Union inland navigation\ncertificate\u2019: The provision must be complied with by the time of the next issue\nor renewal of the Union inland navigation certificate after the date indicated.\nTable 3\n Article and paragraph || Content || Deadline and comments || Valid for craft with vessel certificate or traffic licence apply; \u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 (b) in craft or in on-board machinery after 30.6.2007 the exhaust gas limit values as referred to in Annex XV of Directive 97/68 apply. NRC, at the latest on issue or renewal of the Union inland navigation certificate after 1.1.2010 || 1.1.2006 \nArticle 24.07\n(Left void)\nArticle 24.08\nTransitional provision applicable\nto Article 2.18\nWhen issuing a Union inland navigation\ncertificate to craft which after 31 March 2007 carried a valid vessel\ncertificate according to the Rhine Vessel Inspection Regulation, the already\nassigned Unique European Vessel Identification Number shall be used, and where\nappropriate completed by ranking first the figure \u20180\u2019.\nCHAPTER 24a\nTRANSITIONAL PROVISIONS FOR CRAFT NOT NAVIGATING ON ZONE R WATERWAYS\nArticle 24a.01\nApplication of\ntransitional provisions to craft already in service \nand validity of previous Union inland navigation certificates\n1.                      \nThe following provisions apply to craft not\nnavigating a Zone R waterway:\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 (a) for which a Union inland\nnavigation certificate was issued for the first time before 30 December 2008; \n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 (b) which obtained another\ntraffic licence before 30 December 2008.\n2.                      \nIt must be proved that those craft comply with\nthe provisions of Chapters 1 to 12 of Annex II to Directive 82/714/EEC on the\ndate on which the Union inland navigation certificate or the other traffic\nlicence is issued.\n3.                      \n\u00a0Union inland navigation certificates delivered\nbefore 30 December 2008 remain valid until the date of expiry indicated on the\ncertificate. Article 2.09(2), remains applicable.\nArticle 24a.02\nDerogations for craft\nalready in service\n1.                      \nWithout prejudice to Article 24a.03 of this\nAnnex and Article 18(-(1g) of this Directive, craft which do not fully comply\nwith the this Directive must be adapted to comply with the provisions of that\nDirective which enter into force after the first issue of their Union inland\nnavigation certificate or other traffic licence in accordance with the\ntransitional provisions listed in table 4.\n2.                      \nThe following definitions apply in table 4:\n\u2013                        \n\u2018NRC\u2019: The provision does not apply to craft\nwhich are already operating, unless the parts concerned are replaced or\nconverted, i.e. the provision applies only to Newly-built craft and to\nthe Replacement or Conversion of the parts or areas concerned. If\nexisting parts are replaced by replacement parts using the same technology and\nof the same type, this does not constitute replacement (\u2018R\u2019) within the meaning\nof the transitional provisions.\n\u2013                        \n\u2018Issue or renewal of the Union inland navigation\ncertificate\u2019: The provision must be complied with by the time of the issue or\nnext renewal of the Union inland navigation certificate after 30 December 2008.\nIf the certificate expires between 30 December 2008 and the day before 30\nDecember 2009, that requirement is, however, only mandatory from 30 December\n2009.\nTable 4\n Article and paragraph || Content || Deadline and comments \n CHAPTER 3 ||   ||   \n 3.03(1)(a) || Location of collision bulkhead || NRC, at the latest on issue or renewal of the Union inland navigation certificate after 30 December 2049 \n 3.03(2) || Accommodations || NRC, at the latest on issue or renewal of the Union inland navigation certificate after 30 December 2024 \n 3.03(2) || Safety equipment || NRC, at the latest on issue or renewal of the Union inland navigation certificate after 30 December 2029 \n 3.03(4) || Gastight separation || NRC, at the latest on issue or renewal of the Union inland navigation certificate after 30 December 2024 \n 3.03(5), second paragraph || Monitoring of doors in the aft-peak bulkhead ||   \n 3.03(7) || Anchors not protruding in foresections of vessels || NRC, at the latest on issue or renewal of the Union inland navigation certificate after 30 December 2049 \n 3.04(3), second sentence || Insulation in engine rooms || NRC, at the latest on issue or renewal of the Union inland navigation certificate \n 3.04(3), third and fourth sentences || Openings and locking devices || NRC, at the latest on issue or renewal of the Union inland navigation certificate \n 3.04(6) || Exits from spaces classified as engine rooms as a result of this Directive || NRC, at the latest on issue or renewal of the Union inland navigation certificate after 30 December 2049 \n CHAPTER 4 ||   ||   \n 4.04 || Draught marks || NRC, at the latest on issue or renewal of the Union inland navigation certificate after 30 December 2024 \n CHAPTER 5 ||   ||   \n 5.06(1), first sentence || Minimum speed || NRC, at the latest on issue or renewal of the Union inland navigation certificate after 30 December 2049 \n CHAPTER 6 ||   ||   \n 6.01(1) || Manoeuvrability required by Chapter 5 || NRC, at the latest on issue or renewal of the Union inland navigation certificate after 30 December 2049 \n paragraph 3 || Permanent lists and ambient temperatures || NRC, at the latest on issue or renewal of the Union inland navigation certificate after 30 December 2024 \n 6.01(7) || Design of rudder stocks || NRC, at the latest on issue or renewal of the Union inland navigation certificate after 30 December 2029 \n 6.02(1) || Presence of separate hydraulic tanks || NRC, at the latest on issue or renewal of the Union inland navigation certificate after 1.1.2026 \n Duplicated pilot valves in case of hydraulic drive units || NRC, at the latest on issue or renewal of the Union inland navigation certificate after 1.1.2026 \n Separated pipework for the second drive unit in case of hydraulic drive units || NRC, at the latest on issue or renewal of the Union inland navigation certificate after 1.1.2026 \n paragraph 2 || \n 7.06(1) || Radar navigation systems and rate-of-turn indicators || Radar navigation systems and rate-of-turn indicators, which have been approved and installed pursuant to a member State\u2019s regulations before 31 December 2012 may continue to be installed and operated until the issue or replacement of the Union inland navigation certificate after 31 December 2018. These systems must be entered in the Union inland navigation certificate under number 52. Radar navigation systems and rate-of-turn indicators, which have been approved since 1 January 1990 pursuant to the regulations concerning the minimum requirements and test conditions for navigation radar systems for navigation on the Rhine and of the regulations concerning the minimum requirements and test conditions for rate-of-turn indicators for navigation on the Rhine may continue to be installed and operated, provided that an installation certificate that is valid in accordance with this Directive or Resolution CCNR 1989-II-35, is available \n 7.09 || Alarm system || NRC, at the latest on issue or renewal of the Union inland navigation certificate after 30 December 2024 \n 7.12 first paragraph || Retractable wheelhouses || NRC, at the latest on issue or renewal of the Union inland navigation certificate. following categories according to Article 9.4a of Directive 97/68/EC: \u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 (aa) H which until 31 December 2005; \u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 are installed in craft or in on-board machinery; Article 9.4a of Directive 97/68/EC: \u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 (aa) D, E, F and G which until 31 December 2006[28]; \u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 (bb) H, I and K which until 31 December 2010; \u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 (cc) J which until 31 December 2011; \u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 are Directive 97/68/EC and which until 30 June 2007, are installed in craft or in on-board machinery; \u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 (e) exchange engines, which until 31 December 2011 are installed in craft or in on-board machinery to replace an engine to which in accordance with points a) to d) above, the regulations do not apply. The dates mentioned in paragraphs (a), (b), (c) and (d) shall be postponed by two years in respect of engines with a production date prior to the mentioned dates. \n CHAPTER 9 ||   ||   \n 9.01(1), certificate after 30 December 2029 \nArticle 24a.03\nDerogations for craft\nwhich were laid down before 1 January 1985\n1.                      \nIn addition to Article 24a.02 of this Annex,\ncraft which were laid down before 1 January 1985 may be exempted from the\nfollowing provisions, under the conditions described in column 3 of table 5 ,\nprovided the safety of the vessel and its crew is ensured in an appropriate\nmanner.\n2.                      \nThe following definitions apply in table 5:\n\u2013                        \n\u2018NRC\u2019: The provision does not apply to craft\nwhich are already operating, unless the parts concerned are replaced or\nconverted, i.e. the provision only applies to Newly-built craft and to\nthe Replacement or Conversion of the parts or areas concerned. If\nexisting parts are replaced by replacement parts using the same technology and\nof the same type, this does not constitute replacement (\u2018R\u2019) within the meaning\nof these transitional provisions.\n\u2013                        \n\u2018Issue or renewal of the Union inland navigation\ncertificate\u2019: The provision must be complied with by the time of the first\nissue or next renewal of the Union inland navigation certificate after 30\nDecember 2008. If the certificate expires between 30 December 2008 and the day\nbefore 30 December 2009, that requirement is, however, only mandatory from 30\nDecember 2009.\nTable 5\n Article and parag raph || ||   || experts/competent persons \n No 27 ||   || Recreational craft \nNote:\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 In accordance with Article 5(7)\nof this Directive, for subjects covered by Annex IV, each Member State may\nallow less stringent requirements for the respective values indicated in the\nfollowing Administrative instructions for craft operating exclusively on Zone 3\nand Zone 4 waterways within its territory.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 In accordance with Article 5(1)\nand (3) of this Directive, for subjects covered by Annex III, each Member State\nmay adopt more stringent requirements for the respective values indicated in\nthe following Administrative instructions for craft operating on Zone 1 and\nZone 2 waterways within its territory.\nADMINISTRATIVE INSTRUCTION No 1\nRequirements relating to the\ncapacity for taking evasive action and turning capacity\n(Articles 5.09 and 5.10 in\nconjunction with Articles 5.02(1), 5.03(1), 5.04 and 16.06 of Annex II)\n1.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 General conditions and boundary conditions relating to\nthe evasive action test\n1.1. According to Article 5.09, vessels and\nconvoys shall be able to take evasive action in good time and the capacity for\nsuch action shall be proved by evasive action manoeuvres in the test area in\naccordance with Article 5.03. This shall be proved by simulated evasive action\nmanoeuvres to port and starboard with prescribed values whereby for specific\nturning speeds of the vessel in response to putting across and then checking\nthe helm a certain time limit shall be complied with.\nDuring tests the requirements of Section 2\nshall be complied with keeping a keel clearance of at least 20 % of the\ndraught, but not less than 0,50 m.\n2. Evasive action test procedure and recording of data\n(Diagram in Annex 1)\n2.1. Evasive action manoeuvres shall be\nperformed as follows:\nWith the vessel or convoy under way at a\nconstant speed of V0 = 13 km/h in relation to the water, at the\nstart of the manoeuvre (time t0 = 0 s, turning speed r = 0\u00b0/min,\nrudder angle \u03b40 = 0\u00b0, engine speed kept constant), evasive\naction to port or starboard is to be initiated by putting across the helm. The\nrudder shall be set to an angle \u03b4, or the steering unit to an angle \u03b4a\nin the case of an active steering device, at the start of the manoeuvre, in\naccordance with the indications given in point 2.3. The rudder angle \u03b4\n(e.g. 20\u00b0 to starboard) shall be maintained until the value r1 of\nthe turning speed referred to in point 2.2 for the corresponding dimensions of\nthe vessel or convoy is reached. When the turning speed r1 is\nreached, the time t1 shall be recorded and the rudder set to the\nsame angle on the opposite side (e.g. 20\u00b0 to port) so as to stop the turn and\ncommence turning in the opposite direction, i.e., to reduce the turning speed\nto r2 = 0 and let it to rise again to the value given in point 2.2.\nWhen the turning speed r2 = 0 is reached, the time t2\nshall be recorded. When the turning speed r3 given in point 2.2 is\nreached, the rudder shall be set in the opposite direction to the same angle\n\u03b4, so as to stop the turning movement. The time t3 shall be\nrecorded. When the turning speed r4 = 0 is reached, the time t4\nshall be recorded and the vessel or convoy shall be returned to its original\ncourse.\n2.2. The following limit values shall be\ncomplied with to reach turning speed r4 depending on the dimensions\nof the vessels or the convoys and on the water depth h:\n   || Dimensions of vessels or convoys L \u00d7 B || Required turning speed r1 = r3 (\u00b0/min) || Limit values for the time t4 (s) in shallow and deep water \n \u03b4 = 20\u00b0 || \u03b4 = 45\u00b0 || 1,2 \u2264 h/T \u2264 1,4 || 1,4 < h/T < 2 || h/T > 2 \n 1 || All motor vessels; single-in-line convoys \u2264 110 \u00d7 11,45 || 20\u00b0/min || 28\u00b0/min || 150 s || 110 s || 110 s \n 2 || Single-in-line convoys up to 193 \u00d7 11,45 or two-abreast convoys up to 110 \u00d7 22,90 || 12\u00b0/min || 18\u00b0/min || 180 s || 130 s || 110 s \n 3 || Two-abreast convoys \u2264 193 \u00d7 22,90 || 8\u00b0/min || 12\u00b0/min || 180 s || 130 s || 110 s \n 4 || Two-abreast convoys up to 270 \u00d7 22,90 or three-abreast convoys up to 193 \u00d7 34,35 || 6\u00b0/min || 8\u00b0/min || [30] || [31] || [32] \nThe times t1, t2, t3\nand t4 required to reach turning speeds r1, r2,\nr3 and r4 shall be recorded in the measurements report in\nAnnex 2. The t4 values shall not exceed the limits given in the\ntable.\n2.3. At least four evasive action\nmanoeuvres shall be carried out, namely:\n\u2013                        \none to starboard with a rudder angle \u03b4 =\n20\u00b0\n\u2013                        \none to port with a rudder angle \u03b4 = 20\u00b0\n\u2013                        \none to starboard with a rudder angle \u03b4 =\n45\u00b0\n\u2013                        \none to port with a rudder angle \u03b4 = 45\u00b0.\nIf necessary (e.g. in the case of\nuncertainty about the values measured or of unsatisfactory manoeuvres), the\nevasive action manoeuvres shall be repeated. The turning speeds given in point\n2.2 and the time limits shall be complied with. For active steering devices or\nspecial types of rudder, a position \u03b4a of the steering unit or\nrudder angle \u03b4a other than \u03b4 = 20\u00b0 and \u03b4 = 45\u00b0 may be\nselected, according to the expert\u2019s assessment, depending on the type of\nsteering system.\n2.4. In order to determine the turning\nspeed, a rate-of-turn indicator in accordance with Appendix VIII this Directive\nshall be on board.\n2.5. In accordance with Article 5.04, the\nload condition during the evasive action manoeuvre shall be between 70 % and\n100 % of the maximum deadweight. If the test is carried out with a smaller\nload, approval for downstream and upstream navigation shall be restricted to\nthat load limit.\nThe procedure for evasive action manoeuvres\nand the terms used are shown in a diagram in Annex 1.\n3. Turning capacity\nThe turning capacity of vessels and convoys\nwhose length (L) does not exceed 86 m and width (B) does not exceed 22,90 m\nshall be considered sufficient under Article 5.10, in conjunction with Article\n5.02(1) when during an upstream turning manoeuvre with an initial speed in\nrelation to the water of 13 km/h, the limit values for stopping facing\ndownstream established in Administrative instruction No 2 are complied with.\nThe keel clearance conditions according to Section 1.1 shall be complied with.\n4. Other requirements\n4.1. Notwithstanding points 1 to 3, the\nfollowing requirements shall be met:\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 (a) for manually controlled\nsteering systems, a single turn of the wheel shall correspond to a rudder angle\nof at least 3\u00b0;\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 (b) for powered steering\nsystems, when the rudder is at maximum immersion, it shall be possible to\nachieve an average angular velocity of 4\u00b0/s over the rudder\u2019s entire turning\nrange.\nThis requirement shall also be checked,\nwith the vessel at full speed, for moving the rudder over a range from 35\u00b0 port\nto 35\u00b0 starboard. In addition, it shall be checked whether the rudder keeps the\nposition of maximum angle at maximum propulsion power. For active steering\nsystems or special types of rudder, this provision applies mutatis mutandis.\n4.2. If any of the additional equipment\nreferred to in Article 5.05 is needed in order to reach the required\nmanoeuvring capacities, it shall comply with the requirements of chapter 6, and\nthe following particulars shall be entered under item 52 of the Union inland\nnavigation certificate:\n\u2018Flanking rudders[33]/bow steering systems[34]/other equipment[35] referred to under item 34 is[36]/are[37] necessary to comply with the\nmanoeuvrability requirements of chapter 5.\u2019\u00bb\n5. Recording of data and reports\nThe measurements, reports and recording of\ndata shall be carried out according to the procedure set out in Annex 2.\nANNEX 1\nto Administrative instruction No 1\nDiagram of the evasive action manoeuvre\n t0 || = || Start of evasive action manoeuvre \n t1 || = || Time to reach turning speed r1 \n t2 || = || Time to reach turning speed r2 = 0 \n t3 || = || \u2026 \u00b0/min ||   \n t1 [s] ||   ||   ||   ||   ||   ||   ||   \n t2 [s] ||   ||   ||   ||   ||   ||   ||   \n t3 [s] ||   ||   ||   ||   ||   ||   ||   \n t4 [s] ||   ||   ||   ||   ||   ||   ||   \n Limit value t4 according to 2.2 || Limit value t4 = \u2026 [s] ||   ||   \nTurning capacity[49]\nGeographic position at start of turning\nmanoeuvre \u2026 km\nGeographic position at end of turning\nmanoeuvre \u2026 km\nSteering apparatus\nType of operation: manual/powered[50]\nRudder angle for each turn of the wheel[51]: \u2026 \u00b0\nAngular velocity of the rudder over the\nwhole range[52]:\n\u2026 \u00b0/s\nAngular velocity of the rudder over the\nrange 35\u00b0 Port to 35\u00b0 Starboard[53]:\n\u2026 \u00b0/s\nADMINISTRATIVE INSTRUCTION No 2\nRequirements concerning prescribed\n(forward) speed, stopping capacity and capacity for going astern\n(Articles 5.06, 5.07 and 5.08 in\nconjunction with Articles 5.02(1), 5.03(1), 5.04 and 16.06 of Annex II)\n1. Maximum prescribed (forward) speed in accordance with Article\n5.06\nThe speed in relation to the water is\nsatisfactory in accordance with Article 5.06(1) when it reaches at least 13\nkm/h. During tests, the following conditions shall be met in the same way as\nfor the stopping test:\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 (a) the keel clearance set out\nin point 2.1 shall be complied with;\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 (b) the measuring, recording,\nregistration and evaluation of test data shall be carried out.\n2. Stopping capacity and capacity for going astern prescribed in\naccordance with Articles 5.07 and 5.08\n2.1. Vessels and convoys are deemed able to\nstop facing downstream in good time in accordance with Article 5.07(1) when\nthis is proved during a test of stopping in relation to the ground facing\ndownstream at an initial speed in relation to the water of 13 km/h, with a keel\nclearance equal to at least 20 % of the draught but not less than 0,50 m.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 (a) In flowing water (current\nvelocity of 1,5 m/s), stopping in relation to the water shall be demonstrated\nover a maximum distance measured in relation to the ground of:\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 550 m for vessels and convoys\nof:\n\u2013              \nlength L > 110 m or\n\u2013              \nwidth B > 11,45 m,\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 or\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 480 m for vessels and convoys of:\n\u2013              \nlength L \u2264 110 m and\n\u2013              \nwidth B \u2264 11,45 m.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 The stopping manoeuvre is\ncompleted on coming to a stop in relation to the ground.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 (b) In standing water (current\nvelocity of less than 0,2 m/s), stopping in relation to the water shall be\ndemonstrated over a maximum distance, measured in relation to the ground of:\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 350 m for vessels and convoys\nof:\n\u2013              \nlength L > 110 m or\n\u2013              \nwidth B > 11,45 m,\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 or\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 305 m for vessels and convoys\nof:\n\u2013              \nlength L \u2264 110 m and\n\u2013              \nwidth B \u2264 11,45 m.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 In standing water, a test shall\nalso be performed to demonstrate that a speed of not less than 6,5 km/h can be\nreached when going astern.\nThe measuring, recording and registration\nof the test data referred to in (a) or (b) shall be carried out in accordance\nwith the procedure set out in Appendix 1.\nThroughout the entire test, the vessel or\nthe convoy shall have adequate manoeuvrability.\n2.2. In accordance with Article 5.04,\nduring the test, vessels shall be loaded as far as possible to 70-100 % of\ntheir deadweight. This load condition shall be evaluated in accordance with\nAppendix 2. When the vessel or the convoy is loaded to less than 70 % at the\ntime of the test, the permitted maximum displacement in downstream navigation\nshall be set in accordance with the actual load, provided that the limit values\nof point 2.1 are complied with.\n2.3. If the actual values of the initial\nspeed and current velocity at the time of the test do not meet the conditions\nset out in point 2.1, the results obtained shall be evaluated according to the\nprocedure described in Appendix 2.\nThe permitted deviation of the initial\nspeed of 13 km/h shall be not more than +1 km/h, and the current velocity in\nflowing water shall be between 1,3 and 2,2 m/s, otherwise the tests shall be\nrepeated.\n2.4. The permitted maximum displacement or\nthe respective maximum load or the maximum immersed cross-section for vessels\nand convoys in downstream navigation shall be determined on the basis of the\ntests and entered in the Union inland navigation certificate.\nAppendix 1 \nto Administrative instruction No 2\nMEASURING, RECORDING AND REGISTRATION OF DATA COLLECTED DURING\nSTOPPING MANOEUVRE TESTS\n1. Stopping manoeuvre\nThe vessels and convoys referred to in\nChapter 5 shall carry out a test in flowing water or in standing water, in a\ntest area, to prove that they are capable of stopping facing downstream only\nwith their propulsion system without the use of anchors. The stopping manoeuvre\nshall, in principle, be carried out in accordance with figure 1. It begins when\nthe vessel is travelling at a constant speed of as near as possible to 13 km/h\nin relation to the water by reversing the engines from \u2018ahead\u2019 to \u2018astern\u2019\n(point A of the order \u2018stop\u2019) and is completed when the vessel is\nstationary in relation to the ground (point E: v = 0 in relation to the\nground or point D: = point E: v = 0 in relation to the water and\nin relation to the ground if the stopping manoeuvre is carried out in standing\nwater).\nWhen stopping manoeuvres are carried out in\nflowing water, the position and the moment of stopping in relation to the water\nshall also be recorded (the vessel moves at the speed of the current; point D:\nv = 0 in relation to the water).\nThe data measured shall be entered in a\nreport as shown in the diagram of table 1. Before the stopping manoeuvre is\ncarried out, the unchanging data shall be entered at the top of the form.\nThe average current velocity (vSTR)\nin the fairway shall be determined, if available, based on the reading of an\nestablished water level gauge, or by measuring the movement of a floating body\nand shall be entered in the report.\nIn principle, the use of current metres is\npermitted to determine the speed of the vessel in relation to the water during\nthe stopping manoeuvre, if it is possible to record the movement and the\nrequired data in accordance with the procedure above.\n2. Registration of the data measured and recording them in the\nreport (table 1)\nFor the stopping manoeuvre, first of all\nthe initial speed in relation to the water shall be determined. This can be\ndone by measuring the time taken to travel between two markers on land. In\nflowing water, the average current velocity shall be taken into account.\nThe stopping manoeuvre is initiated by the\norder \u2018stop\u2019A, given on passing a marker on land. Passing the land\nmarker shall be recorded perpendicularly to the axis of the vessel and shall be\nentered in the report. Passing all other land markers during the stopping\nmanoeuvre shall be similarly recorded and each marker (e.g. kilometre post) and\nthe time of passing shall be noted in the report.\nThe values measured shall, if possible, be\nrecorded at intervals of 50 m. In each case, note should be taken of the time\nwhen points B and C \u2014 if possible \u2014 as well as when points D\nand E are reached and the respective position shall be estimated. The\ndata concerning the engine speed need not be recorded in the report, but should\nbe noted to permit more accurate control of the initial speed.\n3. Description of the stopping manoeuvre\nThe stopping manoeuvre according to figure\n1 shall be presented in the form of a diagram. First of all, the time-traverse\ndiagram shall be plotted using the measurements entered in the test report and\npoints A to E shall be indicated. It will then be possible to\ndetermine the average speed between two measurement points and to plot the\nspeed/time diagram.\nThis is done as follows (see figure 1):\nBy determining the quotient of the\ndifference of position over the difference in time \u0394s/\u0394t, the average\nspeed of the vessel for this period can be calculated.\nExample:\nDuring the interval between 0 sec. and 10\nsec., the distance from 0 m to 50 m is covered.\n\u0394s/\u0394t = 50 m/10 s = 5,0 m/s = 18,0 km/h\nThis value is entered as the average speed at\nthe 5 sec. abscissa-position. During the second interval, from 10 sec. to 20\nsec., a distance of 45 m is covered.\n\u0394s/\u0394t = 45 m/10 s = 4,5 m/s = 16,2 km/h\nAt marker D, the vessel has stopped\nin relation to the water i.e. current velocity is approximately 5 km/h.\nFigure 1\nStopping manoeuvre\nKey to symbols in figure 1\n A ||   || \u2018stop\u2019 order \n B ||   || propeller stopped \n C ||   || propeller in reverse \n D ||   || v = 0 in relation to the water \n E ||   || v = 0 in relation to the ground \n v ||   || speed of vessel \n vL ||   || v in relation to the ground \n s ||   || distance covered in relation to the ground \n t ||   || measured time \nTable 1\nReport of the stopping manoeuvre\n Inspection Body: || \u2026 || Type of vessel or convoy: || \u2026 || Test area: || \u2026 \n L \u00d7 B [m]: || \u2026 || Water level gauge reading || [m]: || \u2026 \n Date: || \u2026 || T at test [m]: || \u2026 || Water depth || [m]: || \u2026 \n Name: || \u2026 || Load at Test [t]: || \u2026 || Gradient || [m/km]: || \u2026 \n Test run No: || \u2026 || % of maximum deadweight || \u2026 || VSTR || [km/h]: || \u2026 \n   ||   || Power of propulsion engines PB[kW] || \u2026 || [m/s]: || \u2026 \n   ||   || Propulsion system according to Annex 2, table 2: || \u2026 || Max. displacement || [m3]: || \u2026 \n Position [river-km] || Time [sec.] || \u0394s [m] || \u0394t [sec.] || vIL [km/h] || Engine speed n [min\u20131] || Observations \n   ||   ||   ||   ||   ||   ||   \n   ||   ||   ||   ||   ||   ||   \n   ||   ||   ||   ||   ||   ||   \n   ||   ||   ||   ||   ||   ||   \n   ||   ||   ||   ||   ||   ||   \nAppendix 2\nto Administrative instruction No 2\nEVALUATION OF THE RESULTS OF THE\nSTOPPING MANOEUVRE\n1.                      \nOn the basis of the values recorded compliance\nwith the limit values in accordance with Appendix 1 shall be verified. If the\nconditions for the stopping manoeuvre deviate substantially from the standard\nconditions, or if there are doubts as to the compliance with the limit values,\nthe results shall be evaluated. To that end the following procedure may be\napplied for calculating stopping manoeuvres.\n2.                      \nTheoretical stopping distances are determined\nunder the standard conditions (Sreference) of point 2.1 of Administrative\ninstruction No 2 and under stopping manoeuvre conditions (Sactual) and are\ncompared with the stopping distance measured (Smeasured). The corrected\nstopping distance of the stopping manoeuvre under standard conditions (Sstandard)\nis calculated as follows:\nFormula 2.1:\nSSTANDARD = SMEASURED\u0387(SREFERENCE/SACTUAL)\n\u2264 Limit value in accordance with point 2.1(a) or (b) of Administrative\ninstruction No 2\nWhen the stopping manoeuvre has been carried\nout with a load of 70-100 % of the maximum deadweight in accordance with point\n2.2 of Administrative instruction No 2 in order to calculate Sstandard\nthe displacement (Dreference= Dactual)\ncorresponding to the load at the time of the test shall be used for the\ndetermination of Sreference and Sactual.\nWhen in determining Sstandard\naccording to formula 2.1, the limit value in question is exceeded or not\nreached, the value of Sreference shall be reduced or\nincreased by variation of Dreference so that the limit value\nis complied with (Sstandard = limit value in question). The\nmaximum displacement permitted in downstream navigation shall be set\naccordingly.\n3.                      \nAccording to the limit values given in point\n2.1(a) and (b) of Administrative instruction No 2, only the stopping distances\nmeasured in\n\u2013                        \nPhase I (\u2018Full ahead\u2019 reversed to \u2018full\nastern\u2019): SI\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 and\n\u2013                        \nPhase II (End of reversal until vessel stops in\nrelation to the water): SII\nshall be calculated (see figure 1). The total\nstopping distance is then:\nFormula 3.1:\nStotal = SI + SII4.\nThe particular stopping distances shall be calculated as follows:\nCALCULATION OF THE STOPPING MANOEUVRE\nFigure 2\nDiagram\n   || Calculation Formulae: || with the following coefficients \n 4.1. || SI = k1 \u0387 vL \u0387 t1 || tI \u2264 20 s || \u2014 k1 according to table 1 \n 4.2. || SII = k2 \u0387 vII2 \u0387 (D \u0387 g)/(k3 \u0387 FPOR + RTmII \u2013 RG) \u0387 (k4 + (VSTR/VII)) || \u2014 k2, k3, k4 according to table 1 \n 4.3. || RTmII = (RT/v2) \u0387 (k7 \u0387 k6 \u0387 (vL \u2013 vSTR))2 || \u2014 k6, k7 according to table 1 \u2014 RT/v2 according to table 3 \n 4.4. || RG = i \u0387 D \u0387 \u03c1 \u0387 g \u0387 10\u20136 ||   \n 4.5. || VII = k6 \u0387 (VL \u2013 VSTR) || \u2014 k6 according to table 1 \n 4.6. || FPOR = f \u0387 PB || \u2014 f according to table 2 \n 4.7. || tII = (SII/(vII \u0387 (k4 + (vSTR/vII)))) || \u2014 k4 according to table 1 \nIn formulae 4.1 to 4.7:\n vL || Speed in relation to the ground at the start of reversal || (m/s) \n tI || Reversal time || (s) \n vII || Speed in relation to the water at the end of reversal || (m/s) \n D || Displacement || (m3) \n FPOR || Bollard pull in reverse || (kN) \n PB || Power of propulsion engine || (kW) \n RTmII || Average resistance during phase II, to be determined using the diagram for determining RT/v2 || (kN) \n RG || Gradient resistance || (kN) \n i || Gradient in m/km (if missing to be taken as 0,16) || (m/km) \n vSTR || Average current velocity || (m/s) \n g || Acceleration due to gravity (9,81) || (m/s2) \n \u03c1 || Density of water, \u03c1 fresh water = 1000 || (kg/m3) \n T || Maximum draught (of vessel or convoy) || (m) \n h || Water depth || (m) \n B || Width || (m) \n L || Length || (m) \nThe coefficients for the formulae 4.1, 4.2,\n4.3, 4.4, 4.5, 4.6 and 4.7 can be taken from the tables below.\nTable 1\nk\nfactors for:\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 (a) Motor vessels and single\nfile convoys\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 (b) Two-abreast convoys\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 (c) Three-abreast convoys\n   || a || b || c || Units \n k1 || 0,95 || 0,95 || 0,95 || \u2014 \n k2 || 0,115 || 0,120 || 0,125 || (kg \u0387 s2)/m4 \n k3 || 1,20 || 1,15 || 1,10 || \u2014 \n k4 || 0,48 || 0,48 || 0,48 || \u2014 \n k6 || 0,90 || 0,85 || 0,80 || \u2014 \n k7 || 0,58 || 0,55 || 0,52 || \u2014 \nTable 2\nCoefficient f for ratio between\nbollard pull in reverse and the power of the propulsion engines\n Propulsion system || f || Units \n Modern nozzles with rounded rear edge || 0,118 || kN/kW \n Old nozzles with sharp rear edge || 0,112 || kN/kW \n Propellers without nozzle || Determination of corrected stopping distance compared to standard\nconditions\n\u2013                        \nMeasured value\naccording to Appendix 1 (see point 2)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 smeasured =\n340 m\n\u2013                        \nto be calculated:\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 sactual as the\nsum of\n sIactual ||   || (according to formula 4.1 of Appendix 2 with vLactual) \n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 and\n sIIactual ||   || (according to formulae 4.2, 4.3, 4.4, 4.5 and 4.6 of Appendix 2 with actual speeds vIIactual, vSTRactual, Dactual) \n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 sreference as\nthe sum of\n sIreference ||   || (according to formula 4.1 of Appendix 2 with vLreference) \n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 and\n sIIreference ||   || (according to formulae 4.2 to 4.6 of Appendix 2 with the reference speeds according to 2.1 of the Administrative instruction and given that the load condition is greater than 70 % of the maximum load (\u2248 80 %): Dreference = Dactual and Treference = Tactual) \n\u2013                        \nto be checked:\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Sstandard = Smeasured\n\u0387 (Sreference/Sactual) \u2264 550 m\n4.1. Coefficients for the calculation taken\nfrom Appendix 2\nTable 1\n for sIactual and sIreference || k1 || = || 0,95 \n for sIIactual and sIIreference || k2 || = || 0,12 \n   || k3 || = || 1,15 \n   || k4 || = || 0,48 \n   || k6 || = || 0,85 \n   || k7 || = || 0,55 \nTable 2 (for modern nozzles with rounded\nrear edge)\nf = 0,118\n4.2. Calculation of Sactual\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 (a)sIactual\nwith the values measured during the stopping manoeuvre (formula 4.1)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 SIactual\n= k1 \u0387 vLactual \u0387 tIactual\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 SIactual =\n0,95 \u0387 4,9 \u0387 16 = 74,5 m\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 (b) Formula for sIIactual\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 SIIactual = k\n\u0387 v2IIactual \u0387 ((Dactual\n\u0387 g)/(k3 \u0387 FPOR + RTmIIactual\n\u2013 RG)) \u0387 (k4 + ((VSTRactual)/(VIIactual)))\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 (c) Calculation of RTmIIactual\naccording to table 3 and formula 4.3 of Appendix 2\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 (Dactual)1/3\n= 51791/3 + 17,3 [m]\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 (Dactual)1/3\n\u0387 (B + 2 \u0387 Tactual) = 17,3 \u0387 (22,8 +\n5,92) = 496,8 [m2]\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 according to table 3 (RT/v2)\n= 10,8 [(kN \u0387 s2)/(m2)]\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 vLactual \u2013 vSTRactual\n= 4,9 \u2013 1,4 = 3, 5 m/s\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 RTmIIactual =\n(RT/v2) \u0387 (k7 \u0387\nk6 \u0387 (vLactual \u2013 vSTRactual))2\n= 10,8 \u0387 (0,55 \u0387 0,85 \u0387 3,5)2 = 28,8[kN]\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 (d) Calculation of resistance to\ngradient RG according to formula 4.4\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 RG = 10-6\n\u0387 (0,16 \u0387 Dactual \u0387 \u03c1 \u0387 g)\n= 10-6 \u0387 (0,16 \u0387 5179 \u0387 1000 \u0387 9,81) = 8,13[kN]\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 (e) Calculation of vIIactual\naccording to formula 4.5\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 vIIactual = k6(vLactual \u2013 vSTRactual)\n= 0,85 \u0387 3,5 = 2,97 [m/s]\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 vIIactual2 = 8,85 [m/s]2\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 (f) Calculation of FPOR\naccording to formula 4.6 and table 2\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 FPOR = 0,118\n\u0387 1500 = 177[kN]\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 (g) Calculation of sIIactual\nusing formula (b) and the results of (c), (d), (e) and (f)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 sIIactual =\n((0,12 \u0387 8,85 \u0387 9,81 \u0387 (0,48 + (1,4/2,97)))/(1,15 \u0387 177 +\n28,8 \u2013 8,13)) \u0387 5179\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 sIIactual = 228,9\nm\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 (h) Calculation of total\ndistance according to formula 3.1\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 sactual =\n74,51 + 228,9 = 303,4 m\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Note: The term (RtmII\n\u2014 RG), which is a function of D, with an actual value of\n20,67 kN is obviously relatively small compared to k3 \u0387 FPOR\nwith an actual value of 203,55 kN, so for simplification purposes, sII\ncan be taken as proportional to D, i.e. sII = Constant\n\u0387 D.\n4.3. Calculation of sreference\nInitial values\n vSTRreference = 1,5 m/s = 5,4 km/h || Dreference = Dactual = 5179m3 \n vSreference = 3,6 m/s = 13 km/h || Treference = Tactual = 2,96 m \n vLreference = 5,1 m/s = 18,4 km/h ||   \n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 (a)SIreference = k1\n\u0387 vLreference \u0387 tI\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 SIreference =\n0,95 \u0387 5,1 \u0387 16 = 77,50 m\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 (b)SIIreference =\nk2 \u0387 v2IIreference \u0387 (Dreference\n\u0387 g)/(k3 \u0387 FPOR + RTmIIreference\n\u2013 RG) \u0387 (k4\n+ ((vSTRreference)/vIIreference))\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 (c)\ncalculation of RTmIIreference\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 (RT/v2)\n= 10,8 [(kN \u0387 s2)/(m2)] as in\npoint 4.2, since B, D and T are unchanged.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 vLreference \u2013 vSTRreference\n= 3,6 [m/s]\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 RTmIIreference\n= (RT/v2) \u0387 (k7\n\u0387 k6 \u0387 (vLreference \u2013 vSTRreference))2\n= 10,8 \u0387 (0,55 \u0387 0,85 \u0387 3,6)2 = 30,99[kN]\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 (d) Resistance due to gradient RG\nas in point 4.2\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 (e) Calculation of vIIreference\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 vIIreference =\nk6 \u0387 (vLreference \u2013 vSTRreference)\n= 0,85 \u0387 3,6 = 3,06 [m/s], v2IIreference\n= 9,36 [m/s]2\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 (f)FPOR as in\npoint 4.2.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 (g) Calculation of sIIreference\nusing formula (b) and the result from (c) to (f)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 sIIreference =\n(0,12 \u0387 9,36 \u0387 9,81 \u0387 (0,48 + (1,5/3,06)))/(1,15 \u0387 177 +\n30,99 \u2013 8,13) \u0387 5179\n = || 0,0472 || \u0387 5179 = 244,5 m \n Constantreference \n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 (h) Calculation of total\ndistance\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 sreference = sIreference\n+ sIIreference = 77,5 + 244,5 = 322 m\n4.4. Verification of compliance with\npermissible stopping distance under standard conditions sstandard\naccording to formula 2.1 of Appendix 2\nsstandard = smeasured \u0387 (sreference/sactual)\n= 340 \u0387 (322/303,4) = 360,8 m < 550 m\nConclusion:\nThe permissible limit value is far from\nbeing reached, i.e.:\n\u2013                        \nadmission to downstream navigation is possible\nwithout problems for the actual load condition (0,8 \u0387 Dmax),\n\u2013                        \na higher load condition is possible and may be\ncalculated according to point 5 below.\n5. Possible increase of Dactual in downstream navigation\n(sstandard)Limit\n= smeasured \u0387 (((sreference)Limit)/sactual)\n= 550 m\n(sreference)Limit\n= 550 \u0387 (sactual/smeasured) = 550\n\u0387 (303,4/340) = 490,8 m\nWith sIIreference =\nConstantreference \u0387 D according to the note under point\n4.2\n(sreference)Limit\n= (sIreference + sIIreference)Limit\n= sIreference + 0,0472 \u0387 (Dreference)Limit\nHence\n(Dreference)Limit\n= ((sreference)Limit \u2013 sIreference)/0,0472\n= (490,8 \u2013 77,5)/0,0472 = (8756m3)\nFrom this follows that:\nSince (Dreference)Limit\n> Dmax (8756 > 6474) this formation (see point 1) may\nbe permitted in downstream navigation with full load.\nEXAMPLE II\n1. Data of vessels and convoy\nFormation: large motor vessel propelling\n2 lighters side-by-side in front and\n1 lighter coupled side-by-side\n   || L [m] || B [m] || T max [m] || Dwt[55]max [t] || D max [m3] || PB [kW] \n Motor vessel || 110 || 11,4 || 3,5 || 2900 || 3731 || 1500 \n Each lighter || 76,5 || 11,4 || 3,7 || 2600 || 2743 || \u2014 \n Convoy || 186,5 || 22,8 || 3,7 || 10700 || 11960 || 1500 \n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Propulsion system of the\nself-propelled vessel: modern nozzles with rounded rear edge.\n2. Values measured during the stopping manoeuvre\n Current velocity: || vSTRactual || = || 1,4 m/s || \u2248 || 5,1 km/h \n Speed of vessel (in relation to the water): || VSactual || = || 3,5 m/s || \u2248 || 12,5 km/h \n Speed of vessel (in relation to the bank): || VLactual || = || 4,9 m/s || \u2248 || 17,6 km/h \n Reversal time (measured) (point A to C): || tI || = || 16 sec ||   ||   \n Stopping distance in relation to the water (point A to D): || smeasured || = || 580 m ||   ||   \n Load condition (possibly estimated): || Dactual || = || 9568 m3 || \u2248 || 0,8 Dmax \n Actual draught of convoy: || Tactual || = || 2,96 m || \u2248 || 0,8 Tmax \n3. Limit value according to paragraph 2.1(a) or (b) of the\nAdministrative instruction to be compared with sstandard\nSince B > 11,45 and the convoy is\nin flowing water, the following applies for this convoy under point 2.1(a):\nsstandard \u2264 550 m\n4. Determination of the corrected stopping distance compared with\nstandard conditions\n\u2013                        \nMeasured value:\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 smeasured =\n340 m\n\u2013                        \ncalculations to be made:\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 sactual as the sum of\n sIactual ||   || (according to formula 4.1 of Appendix 2 with VLactual) \n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 and\n sIIactual ||   || (according to formulae 4.2, 4.3, 4.4, 4.5 and 4.6 of Appendix 2 with real speeds vLactual (see under 2 above) and Dactual) \n sreference: sum sIreference + sIIreference ||   || (according to formulae 4.1 to 4.6 of Appendix 2 with reference speeds and in conformity of Appendix 2, because the load condition > 70 % of maximum, where Dreference = Dactual and Treference = Tactual) \n\u2013                        \nto be verified:\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 sstandard = smeasured\n\u0387 (sreference/sactual) \u2264 550 m,\notherwise\n\u2013                        \ncalculate:\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 s* standard =\n550 m by reduction of Dactual to D*\n4.1. Coefficients for the calculation\naccording to Appendix 2\nTable 1\n for sIactual and sIreference || k1 || = || 0,95 \n for sIactual and sIreference || k2 || = || 0,12 \n   || k3 || = || 1,15 \n   || k4 || = || 0,48 \n   || k5 || = || 0,85 \n   || k7 || = || 0,55 \nTable 2 (for modern nozzles with rounded\nrear edge)\nf = 0,118\n4.2. Calculation of sIactual\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 (a)sIactual\nUsing the values measured during the stopping manoeuvres\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 sIactual = k1\n\u0387 vLactual \u0387 tIactual\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 sIactual =\n0,95 \u0387 4,8 \u0387 16 = 73 m\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 (b) formula for sIIactual\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 sIIactual = k2\n\u0387 v2IIactual \u0387 ((Dactual\n\u0387 g)/(k3 \u0387 FPOR + RTmIIactual\n\u2013 RG)) \u0387 (k4 +(vSTRactual/vIIactual))\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 (c) Calculation of RTmIIactual\naccording to table 3 and formula 4.3 of Appendix 2\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Dactual1/3\n= 95681/3 = 21,2 [m]\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Dactual1/3\n\u0387 (B + 2 \u0387 Tactual) = 21,2 \u0387 (22,8 \u2013\n5,92) = 609 [m2]\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 from table 3 (RT/v2)\n= 14,0 [(kN \u0387 s2)/(m2)]\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 vLactual \u2013 vSTRactual\n= 4,8 \u2013 1,4 = 3,4 m/s\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 RTmIIactual =\n(RT/v2) \u0387 (k7 \u0387\nk6 \u0387 (vLactual \u2013 vSTRactual))2\n= 14,0 \u0387 (0,55 \u0387 0,85 \u0387 3,4)2 = 35,4[kN]\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 (d) Calculation of resistance\ndue to gradient RG according to formula 4.4 of Appendix 2.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 RG = 10-6\n\u0387 (0,16 \u0387 Dactual \u0387 \u03c1 \u0387 g)\n= 10-6 \u0387 (0,16 \u0387 9568 \u0387 1000 \u0387 9,81) = 15,02[kN]\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 (e) Calculation of vIIactual\naccording to formula 4.5 of Appendix 2\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 vIIactual = k6 \u0387 (vLactual \u0387 vSTRactual) = 2,89[m/s]\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 v2IIactual = 8,35[m/s]2\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 (f) Calculation of FPOR\nacording to formula 4.6 and table 2\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 FPOR = 0,118\n\u0387 1500 = 177[kN]\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 (g) Calculation of sIIactual\nusing formula (b) and the result of (c), (d), (e) and (f)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 SIIactual =\n((0,12 \u0387 8,35 \u0387 9,81 (0,48 + (1,4/2,89)))/(1,15 \u0387 177 + 35,4 \u2013\n15,02)) \u0387 9568\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 SIIactual = 402\nm\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 (h) Calculation of the total\ndistance according to formula 3.1\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 sactual = 73 +\n402 = 475 m\n4.3. Calculation of sreference\nInitial values:\n VSTRreference = 1,5 m/s \u2248 5,4 km/h || Dreference = Dactual = 9568m3 \n VSreference = 3,6 m/s \u2248 13 km/h || Treference = Tactual = 2,96 m \n VLreference = 5,1 m/s \u2248 18,4 km/h ||   \n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 (a)SIreference = k1\n\u0387 vLreference \u0387 t1\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 SIreference =\n0,95 \u0387 5,1 \u0387 16 = 77, 50 m\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 (b)SIIreference =\nk2 \u0387 vIIreference2 \u0387 ((Dreference\n\u0387 g)/(k3 \u0387 FPOR + RTmIIreference\n\u2013 RG)) \u0387 (k4\n+ (vSTRreference/vIIreference))\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 (c)\nCalculation of RTmIIreference\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 (RT/v2\n= 14,0[(kN \u0387 s2)/m2]) as under\npoint 4.2 since B, D and T and unchanged\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 vLreference \u2013 vSTRreference\n= 3,6 [m/s]\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 RTmIIreference\n= 14,0 \u0387 (0,55 \u0387 0,85 \u0387 3,6)2 = 39,6[kN]\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 (d) Resistance due to gradient RG\nas under point 4.2\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 (e) Calculation of vIIreference\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 vIIreference =\n0,85 \u0387 3,6 = 3,06[m/s], vIIreference2\n= 9,36 [m/s]2\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 (f)FPOR as\nunder point 4.2\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 (g) Calculation of SIIreference\nusing formula (b) and the result of (c) to (f)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 SIIreference =\n((0,12 \u0387 9,36 \u0387 9,81 \u0387 (0,48 + (1,5/3,06)))/(1,15 \u0387 177 +\n39,6 \u2013 15,02)) \u0387 9568\n SIIreference = || 0,04684 || \u0387 9568 = 448 m \n Constantreference \n(h) Calculation of the total distance\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Sreference = SIreference\n+ SIIreference = 77,5 + 448 = 525,5 m\n4.4. Verification of compliance with\npermissible stopping distance under standard conditions Sstandard\naccording to formula 2.1 of Appendix 2\nSstandard = Smeasured \u0387 (Sreference/Sactual)\n= 580 \u0387 (525,5/475) = 641 m > 550 m\nConclusion:\nThe limit value has clearly been exceeded; admission to downstream navigation\nis possible only with a load restriction. This restricted load can be\ndetermined in conformity with No 5 below.\n5. D* permissible in downstream navigation according to formula 2.1\nof Appendix 2\nSstandard = Smeasured \u0387 (Sreference*/Sactual)\n= 550 m\nTherefore:\nSreference* = 550 \u0387 (Sactual/Smeasured)\n= SIreference + SIIreference*\nSIIreference* = Constantreference\n\u0387 D* = 0,04684 \u0387 D*\nD* = ((550 \u0387 (475/580) \u2013 77,5)/0,04684) = 7950[m3]\nConsequence:\nSince in downstream navigation the permissible displacement D*\nis only 7950 m3, the permissible deadweight (perm. Dwt.) in this\nformation is approximately:\n(perm.Dwt./max.Dwt.) =\n(D*/Dmax) = (7950/11960) = 0,66\nPermissible deadweight (see point 1)\n0,66 \u0387 10700 = 7112 t\nADMINISTRATIVE INSTRUCTION No 3\nRequirements for coupling systems\nand coupling devices for craft suitable for propelling or being propelled in a\nrigid assembly\n(Articles 16.01, 16.02, 16.06,\n16.07 of Annex II)\nIn addition to the requirements of Chapter\n16 of Annex II, the relevant provisions of the navigational authority\nregulations in force in the Member States shall be observed.\n1. General requirements\n1.1. Every coupling system shall guarantee\nthe rigid coupling of all the craft in a convoy, i.e. under foreseen operating\nconditions the coupling device shall prevent longitudinal or transversal\nmovement between the vessels, so that the assembly can be seen as a \u2018nautical\nunit\u2019\n1.2. The coupling system and its components\nshall be safe and easy to use, enabling craft to be coupled rapidly without\nendangering personnel.\n1.3. The forces arising from foreseen\noperating conditions shall be properly absorbed and safely transmitted into the\nvessel\u2019s structure by the coupling system and its components.\n1.4. A sufficient number of coupling points\nshall be available.\n2. Coupling forces and dimensioning of coupling devices\nThe coupling devices of convoys and\nformations of vessels to be authorised shall be dimensioned so as to guarantee\nsufficient safety levels. This condition is deemed to be fulfilled if the\ncoupling forces determined according to points 2.1, 2.2 and 2.3 are assumed to\nbe the tensile strength for the dimensioning of the longitudinal coupling\ncomponents.\n2.1. Coupling points between pusher and\npushed lighters or other craft:\nFSB = 270 \u0387 PB \u0387 (LS/Bs)\n\u0387 10\u20133[kN]\n2.2. Coupling points between pushing motor\nvessel and pushed craft:\nFSF = 80 \u0387 PB \u0387 (LS/hK)\n\u0387 10\u20133[kN]\n2.3. Coupling points between pushed craft:\nFSL = 80 \u0387 PB \u0387 (L\u2032S/h\u2032K)\n\u0387 10\u20133[kN]A value of 1200 kN is deemed to be sufficient\nfor the maximum coupling force for a pushing craft at the coupling point\nbetween the first pushed craft and the craft coupled ahead of it, even if\nformula in point 2.3 produces a higher value.\nFor the coupling points of all other\nlongitudinal connections between pushed craft, the dimensioning of the coupling\ndevices shall be based on the coupling force determined according to formula in\npoint 2.3.\nWhere:\n FSB, FSF, FSL [kN] ||   || Coupling force of the longitudinal connection; \n PB [kW] ||   || Installed power of the propulsion engine; \n LS [m] ||   || Distance from the stern of the pusher or pushing craft to the coupling point; \n L'S [m] ||   || Distance from the stern of the pushing craft to the coupling point between the first pushed craft and the craft coupled ahead of it; \n hK, h'K [m] ||   || Respective lever arm of the longitudinal connection; \n BS [m] ||   || Width of the pushing craft; \n 270 and 80 [kN/kW] ||   || Empirically established values for the conversion of installed power to thrust while ensuring adequate levels of safety. \n2.4.1.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 For the longitudinal\ncoupling of individual craft at least two coupling points shall be used. Each\ncoupling point shall be dimensioned for the coupling force determined according\nto points 2.1, 2.2 or 2.3. If rigid coupling components are used, a single\ncoupling point may be authorised if that point ensures secure connection of the\ncraft.\nThe tensile strength of the cables shall be\nselected according to the foreseen number of windings. There shall be no more\nthan three windings at the coupling point. Cables shall be selected according\nto their intended use.\n2.4.2.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 In the case of pushers with\na single pushed lighter, formula in point 2.2 can be used to determine the\ncoupling force if such pushers have been authorised to propel several such\nlighters.\n2.4.3.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Sufficient numbers of\nbollards or equivalent devices shall be available and be capable of absorbing\nthe coupling forces arising.\n3. Special requirements for articulated couplings\nArticulated couplings shall be designed so\nas to also ensure a rigid coupling between craft. Compliance with the\nrequirements of Chapter 5 shall be checked during navigation tests with a rigid\nconvoy in accordance with Article 16.06.\nThe drive unit of the articulated coupling\nshall enable a satisfactory return from the articulated position. The requirements\nof Articles 6.02 to 6.04 shall be applied mutatis mutandis, hence when a\npowered drive unit is used, a second independent drive unit and energy source\nshall be available in the event of failure.\nIt shall be possible to operate and monitor\nthe articulated coupling (its articulated movement, at least) from the\nwheelhouse, the requirements of Articles 7.03 and 7.05 shall be applied mutatis\nmutandis.\nADMINISTRATIVE INSTRUCTION No 4\nApplication\nof Transitional provisions \n(Chapters 15 to 22b, Chapter 24 and Chapter 24a of\nAnnex II)\n1.                      \nApplication of transitional provisions in\njoining together parts of craft \n1.1.                \nPrinciples \nWhere parts of different vessels are joined\ntogether, status quo protection shall be granted only for the parts which\nbelong to the vessel which retains its Union inland navigation certificate.\nTransitional provisions may therefore be invoked only for those parts. Other\nparts shall be treated as a newly built vessel. \n1.2.                \nApplication of the transitional provisions in\ndetail\n1.2.1.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Where parts of different\nvessels are joined together, transitional provisions may be invoked only for\nthose parts which belong to the vessel which retains its Union inland\nnavigation certificate. \n1.2.2\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Parts which do not belong to\nthe vessel which retains its vessel certificate shall be treated as a newly\nbuilt craft. \n1.2.3\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 After a vessel has had part\nof another vessel added to it, the former shall receive the European vessel\nidentification number of the craft, which retains its Union inland navigation\ncertificate as the converted craft.\n1.2.4\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Where an existing Union\ninland navigation certificate is retained or a new Union inland navigation\ncertificate is issued for a craft after a conversion, the year of construction\nof the oldest part of the craft shall additionally be entered in the Union\ninland navigation certificate.\n1.2.5\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 If a new fore section is\nattached to a craft, the engine for the bow thruster system installed in the\nfore section shall also comply with the current requirements.\n1.2.6\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 If a new stern section is\nattached to a vessel, the engines installed in the stern section shall also\ncomply with the current requirements.\n1.3\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Examples for illustration\n1.3.1\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 A vessel is put together\nfrom two older vessels (vessel 1 year of construction 1968; vessel 2 year of construction\n1972). The whole of vessel 1 apart from the fore section is used; of vessel 2,\nthe fore section is used. The assembled vessel receives vessel 1's Union inland\nnavigation certificate. The fore section of the assembled vessel must now be\nfitted inter alia with anchor niches.\n1.3.2\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 A vessel is put together\nfrom two older vessels (vessel 1 year of construction 1975; vessel 2 year of\nconstruction 1958, oldest component 1952). The whole of vessel 1 apart from the\nfore section is used; of vessel 2, the fore section is used. The assembled\nvessel receives vessel 1's Union inland navigation certificate. The fore\nsection of the assembled vessel must now be fitted inter alia with anchor\nniches. The oldest component from the original vessel 2, with year of construction\n1952, is additionally entered in the Union inland navigation certificate.\n1.3.3\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 The stern section of a\nvessel of year of construction 2001 is attached to a vessel of year of\nconstruction 1988. The engine of the vessel of year of construction 1988 is to\nremain in the vessel. In this case, the engine has to be type approved. The\nengine would also have to be type approved if it was the engine in the 2001\nstern section.\n2.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Application of\ntransitional provisions in the case of a change in the type of craft (intended\nuse of the craft)\n2.1\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Principles\n2.1.1\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 In any decision on the\napplication of transitional provisions in the case of change of the type of\ncraft (vessel type; intended use of the vessel), as regards to Annex II to this\nDirective safety considerations shall be key.\n2.1.2\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 It shall constitute a change\nin the type of craft if the safety requirements applying to the new type of\ncraft are different from those for the old type; this is so if special\nprovisions of Chapters 15 to 22b of Annex II are applicable to the new type\nwhich were not applicable to the old type.\n2.1.3\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 In the case of a change in\nthe type of craft, all special provisions and all requirements specific to this\ntype of craft shall be complied with fully; transitional provisions may not be\ninvoked for these requirements. This also applies to parts which are taken over\nfrom the existing craft and come under these special requirements.\n2.1.4\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 The conversion of a tanker\ninto a dry cargo vessel shall not constitute a change in the type of craft as\ndefined in 2.1.2.\n2.1.5\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 In the case of conversion of\na cabin vessel into a day-trip vessel, all new parts shall comply fully with\nthe current requirements.\n2.2\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Application of the\ntransitional provisions in detail\n2.2.1\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Article 24.02 (2) (NRC),\nresp. Article 24a.02 (2) applies to the parts of the craft that are renewed;\nhence new parts of the craft cannot be subject to the transitional provisions.\n2.2.2\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 For the parts of the craft\nthat are not converted, the transitional provisions shall continue to be\napplicable with the exception of parts according to 2.1.3, second sentence.\n2.2.3\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 If the dimensions of the\ncraft are modified, the transitional provisions no longer apply to those parts\nof the craft that are connected with this modification (e.g. distance of\ncollision bulkhead, freeboard and anchor).\n2.2.4\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 In the case of a change in\nthe type of craft, the special requirements of Annex II that only apply to the\nnew type of craft shall be applicable. All parts and items of equipment that\nare affected by the conversion of the craft must satisfy the current\nrequirements Part II and III of Annex II.\n2.2.5\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 The craft shall then be\ngranted a new or amended Union inland navigation certificate and a note shall\nbe made in fields 7 and 8 of the certificate both of the original construction\nand of the conversion.\n2.3\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Examples for illustration\n2.3.1\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 A cargo vessel (year of\nconstruction 1996) is converted into a passenger vessel. Chapter 15 of Annex II\nthen applies to the whole vessel, without invoking transitional provisions. If\nthe fore section is not modified either according to the conversion plans or in\naccordance with Chapter 15, the vessel does not need to present any anchor\nniches in accordance with Article 3.03.\n2.3.2\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 A tug (year of construction\n1970) is converted into a pusher. The physical conversion consists solely of\nchanging the deck equipment and installing a pushing device. All transitional\nprovisions for a 1970 vessel remain applicable, except for the Chapters 5, 7\n(in part), Article 10.01 and Article 16.01.\n2.3.3\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 A motor tanker (year of\nconstruction 1970) is converted into a pusher. The physical conversion consists\nof separating off the fore section and the cargo section, as well as changing\nthe deck equipment and installing a pushing device. All transitional provisions\nfor a 1970 vessel remain applicable, except for the provisions of Chapters 5, 7\n(in part), Article 10.01 and Article 16.01.\n2.3.4\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 A motor tanker is converted\ninto a motor cargo vessel. The motor cargo vessel must comply with current\nworkplace safety requirements, particularly those referred to in Article 11.04\nof Chapter 11 of Annex II.\n3.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Application of\ntransitional provisions in the case of conversion of passenger vessels\n3.1\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Application of the\ntransitional provisions\n3.1.1\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Conversion measures that are\nnecessary in order to comply with requirements of Chapter 15, no matter when\nthey are carried out, shall not constitute conversion 'C' within the meaning of\nArticle 24.02(2), Article 24.03(1) or Article 24.06(5) of Annex II, resp.\nArticle 24a.02, Article 24a.03.\n3.1.2\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 In the case of conversion of\na cabin vessel into a day-trip vessel, all new parts shall comply fully with\nthe current requirements.\n3.2\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Examples for illustration\n3.2.1\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 A passenger vessel (year of\nconstruction 1995) must have a second independent propulsion system installed\nby 1 January 2015 at the latest. If no other voluntary conversions are made on\nthis passenger vessel, it is not necessary to carry out a stability calculation\nin accordance with the new requirements, but if there is an objective need for\none, a stability calculation may be carried out in accordance with the original\nstability requirements of a Member State.\n3.2.2\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 A passenger vessel (year of\nconstruction 1994, vessel certificate last renewed 2012) will be extended by 10\nm in 2016. In addition, this craft must be given a second independent\npropulsion system. Also, a new stability calculation will be necessary, which\nmust be carried out in accordance with Chapter 15 for the one-compartment\nstatus and the two-compartment status.\n3.2.3\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 A passenger vessel (year of\nconstruction 1988) receives a more powerful propulsion system including\npropellers. This is such a major conversion that a stability calculation is\nrequired. This must be carried out in accordance with current requirements.\nADMINISTRATIVE INSTRUCTION No 5\nNoise measurements\n(Article 3.04(7), Article 7.01(2), Article 7.03(6), Article 7.09(3),\nArticle 8.10, Article 11.09(3), Article 12.02(5), Article 17.02(3)(b), and\nArticle 17.03(1) of Annex II)\n1. General\nIn order to check the maximum sound\npressure levels given in Annex II, measured values, measurement procedures and\nconditions for the quantitative, reproducible recording of sound pressure\nlevels in accordance with points 2 and 3 shall be established.\n2. Measuring instruments\nThe measuring instrument shall meet the\nrequirements of class 1 according to EN 60651:1994.\nBefore and after each set of measurements,\na class 1 calibrator according to EN 60942:1998 shall be placed on the\nmicrophone in order to calibrate the measurement system. The compliance of the\ncalibrator with the requirements of EN 60942:1998 shall be checked once per\nyear. The compliance of the measuring equipment with the requirements of EN\n60651:1994 shall be checked every two years.\n3. Noise measurements\n3.1. On board craft\nMeasurements shall be carried out in\naccordance with ISO 2923:2003 Sections 5 to 8 measuring only A-weighted sound\npressure levels.\n3.2. Air noise emitted from craft\nNoise emissions from craft on inland\nwaterways and in ports are determined by means of measurements in accordance\nwith EN ISO 22922:2000, Sections 7 to 11. Doors and windows of engine rooms\nshall be closed during measurements\n4. Documentation\nMeasurements shall be recorded according to\nthe \u2018Noise Measurement Report\u2019 (Annex).\nNoise Measurement Report\n\u2013                        \non board craft in accordance with ISO 2923:2003\n\u2013                        \nair noise emitted from craft in accordance with\nEN ISO 2922:2000[56]\nA. In this case\nit might not be possible to take the transversal subdivision into account if it\nis not extended up to the bulkhead deck. This might lead to inappropriate\nsubdivisions of bulkheads. \nInterpretation of the requirement:\nIf a watertight compartment is longer than\nrequired by Article 15.03 paragraph 9 and it contains local subdivisions\nwhich form watertight sub compartments, and between which the minimum damage\nlength can be contained, these can be taken into account in the damaged\nstability calculation.\n\n2.                      \nTransitional requirements for enclosures made\nwith awnings or similar mobileinstallations with regard to stability (Article\n15.03 paragraph 5)\n\nEnclosures made with awnings or similar\nmobile installations can cause problems with the stability of the vessel since,\nif of sufficient size to do so, they influence the heeling moment due to wind\npressure.\nInterpretation of the requirement:\nIn the case of passenger vessels for which\na vessel certificate was issued for the first time before 1 January 2006, or for\nwhich Article 24.06 paragraph 2, second sentence, is invoked, after the\nerection of an enclosure made with awnings or similar mobile installations, a\nnew stability calculation must be made according to this Directive, in so far\nas its lateral plane Awz exceeds 5% of the total lateral plane Aw\nto be taken into account in each case.\nADMINISTRATIVE INSTRUCTION No 7\nSpecial\nanchors with reduced mass\n(Article 10.01(5) of Annex II)\nPart 1:\nAuthorised special anchors\nSpecial\nanchors with a reduced mass, authorised by competent authorities according to\nArticle 10.01 paragraph 5 are listed in the following table. \n Anchor nr. || Accepted reduction of the anchormass (%) || Competent Authority \n 1.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 HA-DU || 30% || Germany \n 2.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 D'Hone Spezial || 30% || Germany \n 3.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Pool 1 (hol) || 35% || Germany \n 4.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Pool 2 (massief) || 40% || Germany \n 5.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 De Biesbosch-Danforth || 50% || Germany \n 6.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Vicinay-Danforth || 50% || France \n 7.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Vicinay AC 14 || 25% || France \n 8.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Vicinay type 1 || 45% || France \n 9.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Vicinay type 2 || 45% || France \n 10.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Vicinay type 3 || 40% || France \n 11.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Stockes || 35% || France \n 12.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 D'Hone-Danforth || 50% || Germany \n 13.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Schmitt HHP-anker || 40% || Netherlands \n 14.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 SHI high holding anchor, type ST (standard) || 30 % || Netherlands \n 15.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 SHI high holding anchor, type FB (fully balanced) || 30 % || Netherlands \n 16.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Klinsmann anchor || 30 % || Netherlands \n \u00a017. HA-DU-POWER Anchor || 50% || Germany \nPART 2\nAuthorisation\nand test procedure of special anchors with reduced mass\n(Reduction\nof the anchor mass values determined in accordance with Article 10.01(1) to (4)\nof Annex II)\n1. Chapter 1 \u2014 Authorisation procedure\n1.1.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Special anchors with\nreduced mass in accordance with Article 10.01(5) of Annex II shall be\nauthorised by the competent authorities. The competent authority determines the\nauthorised reduction of anchor mass for special anchors in accordance with the procedure\noutlined below.\n1.2.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Authorisation as special\nanchor is only possible if the reduction of anchor mass established is at least\n15 %.\n1.3.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Applications for the\nauthorisation of a special anchor in accordance with point 1.1 shall be\nsubmitted to the competent authority of a Member State.
