  \n   || (The following deviating settings, modifications or alterations to the installed on-board sewage treatment plant were found.) \n   ||   \n   ||   \n   ||   \n   ||   \n   ||   \n   || Name of inspector: ||   \n   || Place and date: ||   \n   ||   || Signature: ||   \n (1) Place a cross in the appropriate box. ||   \n     ||   \nPart\nIX\nEquivalent\ntype-approvals\nType\napprovals in Resolution 2010-II-27 of the Central Commission for the Navigation\non the Rhine of 9 December 2010\nAppendix\nVII\nOn-board sewage treatment plant \n- Test procedure -\n1\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 General\n1.1\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Basics\nThe test specification shall be used to verify\nthe suitability of on-board sewage treatment plants on passenger vessels. \nIn this procedure, the process and treatment\ntechnology used shall be examined and approved by means of a test plant.\nConformity of the test plant with the treatment plants in service later is\nassured by applying identical design and dimensioning criteria.\n1.2.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Responsibility and test location\nThe test plant for a range of on-board sewage\ntreatment plant types shall be tested by a technical service. The test\nconditions at the test site are the responsibility of the technical service and\nmust correspond to the conditions specified here. \n1.3\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Documents to be submitted\nThe test shall be carried out on the basis of\nthe information document in accordance with Appendix VI, Part II. \n1.4\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Plant dimensioning specifications \nThe on-board sewage treatment plants shall be\ndimensioned and designed such that the limit values specified in\nArticle 14a.02(2), Tables 1 and 2 in their outflow are not exceeded in the\ncourse of their operation.\n2\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Measures preparatory to testing \n2.1\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 General\nPrior to commencement of the test the\nmanufacturer shall supply the technical service with structural and process\nspecifications of the test plant, to include a complete set of drawings and\nsupporting calculations in accordance with Appendix VI, Part II, and shall\nprovide full information on the on-board sewage treatment plant\u2019s requirements\nin terms of installation, operation and maintenance. The manufacturer shall\nsupply the technical service with information on the mechanical, electrical and\ntechnical safety of the on-board sewage treatment plant to be tested.\n2.2\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Installation and putting into service\nFor the purpose of the test, the manufacturer\nshall install the test plant in such a way as to correspond to the intended\ninstallation conditions on board passenger vessels. Prior to testing the\nmanufacturer must assemble the on-board sewage treatment plant and put it into\nservice. Start-up must be in accordance with the manufacturer\u2019s operating\ninstructions and shall be checked by the technical service. \n2.3\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Run-in phase\nThe manufacturer shall notify the technical\nservice of the nominal duration of the run-in phase up to normal operation in\nweeks. The manufacturer shall specify the point where the run\u2011in phase is\ndeemed to be complete and testing may commence.\n2.4\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Inflow characteristics\nDomestic raw sewage shall be used for testing\nthe test plant. The inflow characteristics as regards pollutant concentrations\nshall be obtained from the on-board sewage treatment plant manufacturer\u2019s\ndimensioning documentation in accordance with Appendix VI, Part II by forming\nthe quotient for the flow rate of organic substances in the form of a BOD5 load\nin kg/d and the design flow rate of sewage Qd in m\u00b3/d. The inflow\ncharacteristics shall be set accordingly by the inspection body. \nFormula 1 \u2013 Calculation of the inflow characteristics\nShould application of formula 1 result in a\nlower average BOD5 concentration of less than\nCBOD5mean = 500 mg/l, at least a mean BOD5 concentration in the\ninflow water of CBOD5,min = 500 mg/l shall be set.\nThe technical service must not break up the\ninflowing raw sewage in a comminatory. Removal of sand (e.g. by screening out)\nis permissible. \n3.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Test procedure\n3.1\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Loading phases and hydraulic feeding\nThe test period shall comprise 30 test days.\nThe test plant shall be fed on the test field with domestic waste water in\naccordance with the loading specified in Table 1. Various loading phases shall\nbe covered, with the test sequence taking account of normal loading phases and\nspecial loading phases such as overload, underload and stand-by operation. The\nduration of each loading phase (number of test days) is set out in\nTable 1. The mean daily hydraulic load for each loading phase shall be set\nin accordance with Table 1. The mean pollutant concentration, to be set in\naccordance with point 2.4, shall be kept constant.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Table 1:\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Load\nsettings for each loading phase \n Phase || Number of test days || Daily hydraulic load || Pollutant concentration \n Normal load || 20 days || Qd || CBOD5 in accordance with 2.4 \n Overload || 3 days || 1,25 Qd || CBOD5 in accordance with 2.4 \n Underload || 3 days || 0.5 Qd || CBOD5 in accordance with 2.4 \n Stand-by || 4 days || Day 1 and day 2: Qd= 0 Day 3 and day 4: Qd || CBOD5 in accordance with 2.4 \nThe special load phases overload, underload and\nstand-by operation shall be carried out consecutively without interruption; the\nnormal load phase shall be divided into several part phases. The test shall\nstart and end with a normal load phase, of at least five days' duration in each\ncase. \nDaily hydraulic feeding hydrographs shall be\nset, depending on the specified operation of the on-board sewage treatment\nplant. The daily hydraulic feeding hydrograph shall be selected in accordance\nwith the plant operation concept for the on-board sewage treatment plant. A\ndistinction shall be made according to whether the on-board treatment plant is\nto be operated with or without an upstream sewage storage tank. The feeding\nhydrographs (daily hydrographs) are shown in Figure 1 and Figure 2. \nThroughout the entire test period the hourly\ninflow must remain constant. The mean hourly volumetric flow rate of sewage\nQh,mean is equivalent to 1/24 of the daily hydraulic load according to Table 1.\nThe inflow shall be measured continuously by the technical service. The daily\nhydrograph must keep within a \u00b15% tolerance.\nFigure 1: Daily hydrograph for feeding of on-board sewage treatment plant with\nupstream sewage storage tank\nFigure 2:\u00a0 Daily hydrograph for feeding of on-board sewage treatment plant\nwithout upstream sewage storage tank\n3.2\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Interruption\nor cancellation of the test\nIt may be necessary to interrupt the test if\nthe test plant can no longer be operated properly due to power failure or the\nmalfunction of a subassembly. The test may be interrupted for the duration of\nthe repair. In such cases it is not necessary to repeat the whole of the test,\nonly the loading phase in which the subassembly malfunction took place.\nAfter the test is interrupted for a second\ntime, the technical service shall decide whether the test may be continued or\nmust be cancelled. The grounds for the decision must be stated and documented\nin the test report. Should the test be cancelled it must be repeated in full.\n3.3\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Examinations of purification\nefficiency and compliance with outflow limit values \nThe technical service shall take samples from\nthe inflow to the test plant and analyse them in order to confirm conformity\nwith the inflow characteristics. Sewage samples shall be taken from the outflow\nof the test plant and analysed to determine the purification efficiency and\ncompliance with the required outflow limit values. Sampling carried out shall\ninclude both simple random samples and 24h composite samples. In the case of\nthe 24h composite samples, either time\u2011proportional or flow\u2011proportional\nsampling may be carried out. The type of 24h composite sample shall be\nspecified by the inspection body. Sampling in the inflow and outflow shall be\ncarried out simultaneously and to the same degree. \nIn addition to the control parameters BOD5, COD\nand TOC the following parameters for inflow and outflow shall be measured in\norder to describe and represent the environmental and test conditions:\n\u00b7              \nsolids removable by filtration (SRF);\n\u00b7              \npH;\n\u00b7              \nconductivity;\n\u00b7              \ntemperature of liquid phases. \nThe number of examinations varies according to\nthe relevant loading phase and is set out in Table 2. The number of samplings\nrelates to the inflow or outflow of the test plant. \nTable 2:\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Specification of the\nnumber and timing of samplings in the inflow and outflow of the test plant \n Loading phase || Number of test days || Number of samplings || Specification of timing of samplings \n Normal load || 20 days || 24h composite samples: 8 Random samples: 8 || Sampling at regular intervals throughout the period \n Overload || 3 days || 24h composite samples: 2 Random samples: 2 || Sampling at regular intervals throughout the period \n Underload || 3 days || 24h composite samples: 2 Random samples: 2 || Sampling at regular intervals throughout the period \n Stand-by || 4 days || 24h composite samples: 2 Random samples: 2 || 24h composite sample: Sampling after inflow switched on and 24h later. Random sample: 1 hour after inflow switched on and 24h later. \n Total number of 24h composite samples: 14\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Total number of random samples: 14 \n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Where applicable, the\nfollowing operating parameters shall also be measured from the random samples\ntaken:\n\u00b7              \nconcentration of dissolved oxygen in the\nbioreactor\n\u00b7              \ndry matter content in the bioreactor;\n\u00b7              \ntemperature in the bioreactor;\n\u00b7              \nambient temperature;\n\u00b7              \nother operating parameters in accordance with\nthe manufacturer\u2019s operating instructions.\n3.4\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Evaluation of examinations\nIn order to document the determined\npurification efficiency and to check adherence to process limit values, the\nminimum sample value (Min), the maximum sample value (Max) and the arithmetical\nmean (Mean) shall be specified as well as the individual measurement results for\ncontrol parameters BOD5, COD and TOC. \nThe loading phase shall also be given for the\nmaximum sample value. Evaluations shall be carried out for all loading phases\njointly. The results shall be processed as shown in the following table:\nTable 3a:\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Specification\nfor the statistical processing of data gathered \u2013 evaluation to document\ncompliance with outflow limit values \n Parameter || Sampling type || Number of test that meet the limitvalues || Mean || Min || Max \n Value || Phase \n Inflow BOD5 || 24h composite samples || --[80] ||   ||   ||   ||   \n Outflow BOD5 || 24h composite samples ||   ||   ||   ||   ||   \n Inflow BOD5 || random samples || -- ||   ||   ||   ||   \n Outflow BOD5 || random samples ||   ||   ||   ||   ||   \n Inflow COD || 24h composite samples || -- ||   ||   ||   ||   \n Outflow COD || 24h composite samples ||   ||   ||   ||   ||   \n Inflow COD || random samples || -- ||   ||   ||   ||   \n Outflow COD || random samples ||   ||   ||   ||   ||   \n Inflow TOC || 24h composite samples || -- ||   ||   ||   ||   \n Outflow TOC || 24h composite samples ||   ||   ||   ||   ||   \n Inflow TOC || random samples || -- ||   ||   ||   ||   \n Outflow TOC || random samples ||   ||   ||   ||   ||   \n Inflow SRF || 24h composite samples || -- ||   ||   ||   ||   \n Outflow SRF || 24h composite samples ||   ||   ||   ||   ||   \n Inflow SRF || random samples || -- ||   ||   ||   ||   \n Outflow SRF || random samples ||   ||   ||   ||   ||   \nTable 3b: Specification for the statistical\nprocessing of data gathered \u2013 evaluation to document purification efficiency \n Parameter || Sampling type || Mean || Min || Max \n Elimination efficiency BOD5 || 24h composite samples ||   ||   ||   \n Elimination efficiency BOD5 || Random samples ||   ||   ||   \n Elimination efficiency COD || 24h composite samples ||   ||   ||   \n Elimination efficiency COD || Random samples ||   ||   ||   \n Elimination efficiency TOC || 24h composite samples ||   ||   ||   \n Elimination efficiency TOC || Random samples ||   ||   ||   \n Elimination efficiency SRF || 24h composite samples ||   ||   ||   \n Elimination efficiency SRF || Random samples ||   ||   ||   \n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 The remaining parameters in\naccordance with 3.3(b) to (d) and the operating parameters in accordance with\n3.3 shall be summarised in a table specifying the minimum sample result (Min),\nthe maximum sample result (Max) and the arithmetical mean (Mean). \n3.5\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Compliance with the\nrequirements of Chapter 14a \n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 The limit values in\naccordance with Article 14a.02(2) Tables 1 and 2 shall be deemed to be upheld,\nwhen each value for the parameters COD, BOD5 and TOC:\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 (a)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 the mean values of\nthe total of 14 outflow samples, and \n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 (b)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 at least 10 of the\ntotal of 14 outflow samples do not exceed the specified limit values for 24h\ncomposite samples and random samples.\n3.6\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Operation and maintenance\nduring testing \n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Throughout the testing the\ntest plant shall be operated in accordance with the manufacturer\u2019s\nspecifications. Routine checks and maintenance work shall be carried out in\ncompliance with the manufacturer\u2019s operation and maintenance instructions. The\nexcess sludge generated by the biological purification process may only be\nremoved from the on-board sewage treatment plant if this is specified by the\nmanufacturer in their operation and maintenance instructions. All maintenance work\ncarried out shall be recorded by the technical service and documented in the\ntest report. During the test no unauthorised persons may have access to the\ntest plant. \n3.7\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Sample analysis / analysis\nmethod\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 The parameters to be studied\nshall be analysed using approved standard procedures. The standard procedure\napplied shall be specified.\n4\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Test report\n4.1\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 The inspection body is\nrequired to compile a report on the type test carried out. The report shall\ninclude at least the following information:\n(a)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 details on the plant tested, such as its type,\ninformation on the nominal daily pollutant load and the dimensioning principles\napplied by the manufacturer;\n(b)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 information on the conformity of the on-board sewage\ntreatment plant tested with the documentation provided before the testing;\n(c)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 information on individual measurement results, as well as\non the evaluation of the plant\u2019s purification efficiency and compliance with\nthe required outflow limit values;\n(d)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 details on the removal of excess sludge, such as the size\nof the volumes removed and the frequency of removal;\ninformation on\nall operation, maintenance and repair work carried out during testing;\n(e)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 information on any deterioration in the quality of the\non-board sewage treatment plant occurring during testing as well as any\ninterruptions of testing;\n(f)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 information\non any problems arising during testing;\n(g)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 a list of responsible persons involved in the type\ntesting of the on-board sewage treatment plant, giving their names and job\ntitles;\n(h)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 name and address of the laboratory which carried out the\nanalysis of the waste water samples;\n(i)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 analysis methods applied.\nExamples\nof test sequences\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Example 1\nExample 2\n DE || EN \n Normallast || Normal load \n \u00dcberlast || Overload \n Unterlast || Underload \n Stand By || Stand-by \n Hydraulische Belastung Qd || Hydraulic load Qd \n Tag || Day \nNotes on\ndetermining biochemical oxygen demand after \nfive days (BOD5)\nin 24h composite samples\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 \nThe International\nStandards ISO 5815 and 5815-2: 2003 stipulate that in order to carry out the\nanalysis to determine biochemical oxygen demand after five days water samples\nshould be stored immediately after sampling and up to the time of analysis in a\nbrim-full, tightly sealed bottle at a temperature of 0\u20134 \u00b0C. The process\nof determining BOD5 should be initiated as soon as possible or at\nleast within twenty-four hours of completion of sampling.\nIn order to\nprevent biochemical degradation processes starting in the 24h composite sample,\nin practice the water sample is cooled to a maximum of 4 \u00b0C while sampling\ncontinues, and is stored at this temperature once the sampling process is\ncomplete.\nSuitable\nsampling equipment is commercially available.\nAppendix VIII\nRadar equipment and rate-of-turn\nindicators used\n\u00a0on board inland waterway vessels\nContents\n\nDefinitions\nPart I\nMinimum requirements and\ntest conditions for radar installations used for navigation on board inland\nwaterway vessels\nPart II\nMinimum requirements and test conditions for\nrate-of-turn indicators used on board inland waterway vessels\nPart III\nRequirements for\ninstallation and performance tests for radar equipment and rate-of-turn\nindicators used on board inland waterway vessels\nPart IV\nInstallation and performance certificate for radar equipment and rate-of-turn\nindicators used on board inland waterway vessels\nPart V\nRegister of competent authorities, technical services, approved\nradar navigation equipment and\nrate-of-turn indicators and\napproved specialised firms\nPart VI\nEquivalent equipment\n\nDefinitions:\n1.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 'Type test' means the test procedure as referred to in\nPart I Article 4 or Part II Article 1.03 which the technical service uses to test for\ncompliance with the requirements according to this Annex. The type test forms\nan integral part of the type approval;\n2.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 'Type approval' means the administrative procedure\naccording, by which a Member State confirms that equipment complies with the\nrequirements of this Annex.\nFor radar\nnavigation equipment this procedure includes the provisions according to\nPart I, Articles 5 to 7 and 9. For rate-of-turn indicators the procedure\nincludes the provisions according to Part II, Articles 1.04 to 1.06 and 1.08;\n3.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 'Test certificate' means the document in which the type\ntesting results are laid down;\n4.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 'Applicant' or 'manufacturer' means any legal or\nnatural person under whose name, trademark or any other form of identification\nthe equipment submitted for testing is manufactured or marketed and who is\nresponsible for all matters as regards the type testing and type approval\nprocedure in respect of the technical service and the approval authority;\n5.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 'Technical service' means the institution, authority or\norganisation that does the type testing;\n6.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 'Manufacturer's declaration' means the declaration by\nwhich a manufacturer gives the assurance that the equipment meets the\nprevailing minimum requirements and that is identical in every respect to the\ntype submitted for testing;\n7.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 'Declaration of conformity according to Directive\n1999/5/EC of the European Parliament and of the Council of 9 March 1999 on\nradio equipment and telecommunications terminal equipment and the mutual\nrecognition of their conformity* means the declaration according to Directive\n1999/5/EC Annex II Paragraph 1, by which the manufacturer confirms that the\nproducts in question meet the applicable requirements of the Directive;\n8.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 'Competent authority' means the official authority that\nissues the type approval.\n(*)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 OJ L 91,\n7.4.1999. p. 10\nPart I\nMinimum requirements and test conditions \nfor radar installations\nused for navigation\non board inland waterway vessels\nTable of contents\nArticle 1 - Scope\nArticle 2 - Purpose of the radar\nnavigation equipment\nArticle\n3 - Minimum requirements\nArticle\n4 - Type tests\nArticle 5 - Application for a type test\nArticle 6 - Type-approval\nArticle 7 - Marking of the equipment and\ntype approval number\nArticle 8 - Manufacturer's declaration\nArticle 9 - Modifications to\ntype-approved equipment\nArticle 1\nScope\nThese provisions set out the minimum\nrequirements for radar equipment used for navigation on board inland waterway\nvessels as well as the conditions for testing conformity with these minimum\nrequirements. \nArticle 2\nPurpose of the radar navigation equipment\nThe radar navigation equipment shall\nfacilitate the navigation of the vessel by providing an intelligible radar\npicture of its position in relation to buoys shorelines and navigational\nstructures, as well as permitting the reliable and timely recognition of other\nvessels and obstructions protruding above the water surface.\nArticle 3\nMinimum requirements\n1.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 With the exception of requirements on electromagnetic\ncompatibility (Article 3.1.b of Directive 1999/5/EC) and of requirements on the\neffective use of the spectrum so as to avoid harmful interference arising from\nArticle 3.2 of Directive 1999/5/EC, radar navigation equipment used in inland\nwaterway vessels shall fulfil the requirements of European standard\nEN 302194-1: 2006:\n2.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Paragraph 1 applies to inland ECDIS equipment which can\nbe operated in navigation mode. This equipment shall additionally fulfil the\nrequirements of the Inland ECDIS standards in the version valid on the date of\nissue of the type approval.\nArticle 4\nType tests\n\u00b7                        \nCompliance with the minimum requirements as\nspecified in Article 3(1) shall be established by means of a type test\n\u00b7                        \nIf the equipment passes the type test the\ntesting establishment shall issue a test certificate. If the equipment fails to\nmeet the minimum requirements, the applicant shall be notified in writing of\nthe reasons for its rejection\nArticle 5\nApplication for a type test\nApplications for\na type test of a radar navigation installation shall be submitted to a\ntechnical service.\nThe technical services\nshall be notified to the competent authorities of the Member States.\n\u00b7                        \nEach application shall be accompanied by the\nfollowing documents\n\u00b7              \ndetailed technical descriptions\n\u00b7              \ncomplete set of installation and service\ndocuments\n\u00b7              \ndetailed operator\u2019s manuals; \n\u00b7              \nshort operator\u2019s manual; and\n\u00b7              \nwhere applicable, evidence of previously\ncompleted tests\n\u00b7                        \nIn case it is not intended by the applicant to\nhave the Declaration of Conformity pursuant to Directive 1999/5/EC established\nconcurrently with the type-approval, a Declaration of Conformity shall be\nsubmitted together with the application for a type test\nArticle 6\nType-approval\n1.                      \nType-approval shall be granted by the competent\nauthority pursuant to the test certificate. \n2.                      \nEach competent authority or the technical\nservice designated by the competent authority shall be entitled to select\nequipment from the production series at any time for inspection\nIf this\ninspection reveals defects in the equipment, type-approval may be withdrawn.\nThe\ntype-approval shall be withdrawn by the authority that issued it.\nArticle 7\nMarking of the equipment and type approval number\n1.                      \nEach component of the equipment shall be marked\nindelibly with \n(a)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 the name of the manufacturer, \n(b)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 the trade designation of the\nequipment, \n(c)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 the type of equipment and \n(d)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 the serial number\n2.                      \nThe type-approval number assigned by the\ncompetent authority shall be affixed indelibly to the display unit in such a\nway that it remains clearly visible after the equipment has been installed\nComposition of a\ntype-approval number: e-NN-NNN\ne\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 =\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 European\nUnion\nNN\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 =\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 number\nfor the country of type-approval, where\n 01 || = || Germany || 18 || = || Denmark \n 02 || = || France || 19 || = || Romania \n 03 || = || Italy || 20 || = || Poland \n 04 || = || Netherlands || 21 || = || Portugal \n 05 || = || Sweden || 23 || = || Greece \n 06 || = || Belgium || 24 || = || Ireland \n 07 || = || Hungary || 26 || = || Slovenia \n 08 || = || Czech Republic || 27 || = || Slovakia \n 09 || = || Spain || 29 || = || Estonia \n 11 || = || United Kingdom || 32 || = || Latvia \n 12 || = || Austria || 34 || = || Bulgaria \n 13 || = || Luxembourg || 36 || = || Lithuania \n 14 || = || Switzerland || 49 || = || Cyprus \n 17 || = || Finland || 50 || = || Malta \nNNN =\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 three-digit\nnumber, to be determined by the competent authority.\n3.                      \nThe type-approval number shall be used only in\nconjunction with the associated type-approval\nIt shall be the\nresponsibility of the applicant to produce and affix the type-approval number.\nArticle 8\nManufacturer's declaration\nEach unit of equipment shall be accompanied\nby a manufacturer's declaration.\nArticle 9\nModifications to type-approved equipment\n1.                      \nAny modification made to equipment already\napproved shall cause the type-approval to be withdrawn. Whenever modifications\nare planned, details shall be sent in writing to the competent technical\nservice.\n2.                      \nThe competent authority shall decide following\nconsultation with the technical service whether the type-approval still applies\nor whether an inspection or new type test is necessary\nIf a new type\ntest is granted, a new type-approval number shall be assigned.\nPart II\nMinimum requirements and test conditions \nfor rate-of-turn indicators\nused on board inland waterway vessels\nTable\nof contents\nChapter\n1\nGeneral\nArticle 1.01 - Scope\nArticle 1.02 - Purpose of the rate-of-turn\nindicator\nArticle 1.03 - Type test\nArticle 1.04 - Application for a type\ntest\nArticle 1.05 - Type-approval\nArticle 1.06 - Marking of the equipment\nand type approval number\nArticle 1.07 - Manufacturer's\ndeclaration\nArticle 1.08 - Modifications to type-approved\nequipment\nChapter\n2\nGeneral minimum requirements for rate-of-turn indicators\nArticle 2.01 - Construction, design\nArticle 2.02 - Spurious emissions and\nelectromagnetic compatibility\nArticle 2.03 - Operation\nArticle 2.04 - Operating instructions\nArticle 2.05 - Installation of the\nsensor\nChapter\n3\nMinimum operational requirements for rate-of-turn indicators\nArticle 3.01 - Operational readiness of\nthe rate-of-turn indicator\nArticle 3.02 - Indication of the rate of\nturn\nArticle 3.03 - Measuring ranges\nArticle 3.04 - Accuracy of the indicated\nrate of turn\nArticle 3.05 - Sensitivity\nArticle 3.06 - Monitoring of operation\nArticle 3.07 - Insensitivity to other\nnormal movements of the vessel\nArticle 3.08 - Insensitivity to magnetic\nfields\nArticle 3.09 - Slave indicators\nChapter\n4\nMinimum technical requirements for rate-of-turn indicators\nArticle 4.01 - Operation\nArticle 4.02 - Damping devices\nArticle 4.03 - Connection of additional\nequipment\nChapter\n5\nTest conditions and procedures for rate-of-turn indicators\nArticle 5.01 - Safety, load capacity and\nelectromagnetic compatibility\nArticle 5.02 - Spurious emissions\nArticle 5.03\n- Test procedure\nAppendix:\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Maximum\ntolerances for indication errors of rate-of-turn indicators\nCHAPTER 1\nGENERAL\nArticle 1.01\nScope\nThese provisions set out the minimum\nrequirements for rate-of-turn indicators used on board inland waterway vessels,\nas well as the conditions for testing conformity with these minimum\nrequirements.\nArticle 1.02\nPurpose of the rate-of-turn indicator\nThe rate-of-turn indicator is intended to\nfacilitate radar navigation, and to measure and indicate the rate of turn of\nthe vessel to port or starboard.\nArticle 1.03\nType test\n1\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Compliance with the minimum requirements for\nrate-of-turn indicators pursuant to Chapters 2 to 4 shall be established by\nmeans of a type test.\n2.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 If the equipment passes the type test the technical\nservice shall issue a test certificate. If the equipment fails to meet the\nminimum requirements, the applicant shall be notified in writing of the reasons\nfor its rejection.\nArticle 1.04\nApplication for a type test\n1.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Applications for a type test of a rate-of-turn\nindicator shall be submitted to a technical service.\nThe technical\nservices shall be notified to the competent authorities of the Member States.\n2.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Each application shall be accompanied by the following\ndocuments:\n(a)         \ndetailed technical descriptions;\n(b)         \ncomplete set of installation and service\ndocuments\n(c)         \noperating instructions\n3.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 By means of tests, the applicant shall establish or\nhave it established that the equipment meets the minimum requirements of these\nprovisions.\nThe results of\nthe test and the measurement reports shall be attached to the application.\nThese documents\nand the information obtained during testing shall be kept by the competent\nauthority.\nArticle 1.05\nType approval\n1.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Type approval shall be granted by the competent\nauthority pursuant to the test certificate.\n2.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Each competent authority or the technical service\ndesignated by the competent authority shall be entitled to select equipment\nfrom the production series at any time for inspection.\nIf this\ninspection reveals defects in the equipment, type approval may be withdrawn.\nThe\ntype-approval shall be withdrawn by the authority that issued it.\nArticle 1.06\nMarking of the equipment and type approval number\n1.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Each component of the equipment shall be marked\nindelibly with\n(a)         \nthe name of the manufacturer, \n(b)         \nthe trade designation of the equipment, \n(c)         \nthe type of equipment and \n(d)         \nthe serial number\n2.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 The type-approval number assigned by the competent\nauthority shall be affixed indelibly to the control unit in such a way that it\nremains clearly visible after the equipment has been installed.\nComposition of a\ntype-approval number: e -NN-NNN\ne\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 =\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 European\nUnion\nNN\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 =\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 code\nfor the country of type-approval,\n 01 || = || Germany || 18 || = || Denmark \n 02 || = || France || 19 || = || Romania \n 03 || = || Italy || 20 || = || Poland \n 04 || = || Netherlands || 21 || = || Portugal \n 05 || = || Sweden || 23 || = || Greece \n 06 || = || Belgium || 24 || = || Ireland \n 07 || = || Hungary || 26 || = || Slovenia \n 08 || = || Czech Republic || 27 || = || Slovakia \n 09 || = || Spain || 29 || = || Estonia \n 11 || = || United Kingdom || 32 || = || Latvia \n 12 || = || Austria || 34 || = || Bulgaria \n 13 || = || Luxembourg || 36 || = || Lithuania \n 14 || = || Switzerland || 49 || = || Cyprus \n 17 || = || Finland || 50 || = || Malta \nNNN\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 =\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 three-digit\nnumber, to be determined by the competent authority.\n3.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 The type-approval number shall be used only in\nconjunction with the associated type-approval.\nIt shall be the\nresponsibility of the applicant to produce and affix the type-approval number.\nArticle 1.07\nManufacturer's declaration\nEach unit of equipment shall be accompanied\nby a manufacturer's declaration.\nArticle 1.08\nModifications to type-approved equipment\n1.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Any modification made to equipment already approved\nshall cause the type-approval to be withdrawn.\nWhenever\nmodifications are planned, details shall be sent in writing to the competent\ntechnical service.\n2.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 The competent authority shall decide following\nconsultation with the technical service whether the type-approval still applies\nor whether an inspection or new type test is necessary.\nIf a new type\ntest is granted, a new type approval number shall be assigned.\nCHAPTER 2\nGENERAL MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS \nFOR RATE-OF-TURN INDICATORS\nArticle 2.01\nConstruction, design\n1.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Rate-of-turn indicators shall be suitable for operation\non board inland waterway vessels.\n2.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 The construction and design of the equipment shall be\nin accordance with current good engineering practice, both mechanically and\nelectrically.\n3.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 In the absence of any specific provision in Annex II or\nin this Annex, the requirements and test methods contained in European Standard\nEN 60945:2002 shall apply to power supply, safety, mutual interference of\nship borne equipment, compass safe distance, resistance to climatic influences,\nmechanical strength, environmental influences, audible noise emission and\nequipment markings. \nAdditionally,\nthe equipment shall satisfy all requirements of this Annex at ambient\ntemperatures between 0 and 40 \u00b0C.\nArticle 2.02\nSpurious emissions and electromagnetic compatibility\n1.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 General requirements\nRate-of-turn\nindicators shall meet the requirements of Directive 2004/108/EC of the European\nParliament and of the Council of 15 December 2004 on the approximation of the\nlaws of the Member States relating to electromagnetic compatibility and\nrepealing Directive 89/336/EEC.\n2.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Spurious emissions\nIn the frequency\nranges of 156 to 165 MHz, 450 to 470 MHz and 1.53 to 1.544 GHz\nthe field strength shall not exceed a value of 15 \u03bcV/m. These field\nstrengths shall apply at a test distance of 3 metres from the equipment\nunder test.\nArticle 2.03\nOperation\n1.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 The equipment shall not have more controls than are\nnecessary for its correct operation.\nThe design,\nmarkings and manipulation of the controls shall be such as to permit their\nsimple, unambiguous and fast operation. Their arrangement shall be such as to\nprevent operational mistakes as far as possible.\nControls that\nare not necessary for normal operation shall not be immediately accessible.\n2.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 All controls and indicators shall be provided with symbols\nor markings in English. Symbols shall meet the requirements of European\nStandard EN 60417:1998. \nAll numerals and\nletters shall be at least 4 mm high. If it can be demonstrated that, for\ntechnical reasons, numerals and letters 4 mm high are not possible and if\nfor the purposes of operation smaller numerals and letters are acceptable, a\nreduction to 3 mm shall be allowed.\n3.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 The equipment shall be designed in such a way that\noperating mistakes cannot cause its failure.\n4.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Any functions over and above the minimum requirements,\nsuch as facilities for connection to other equipment, shall be provided in such\na way that the equipment meets the minimum requirements under all conditions.\nArticle 2.04\nOperating instructions\nA detailed operator's manual shall be\nsupplied with each unit. It shall be available in Dutch, English, French and\nGerman and shall contain at least the following information:\nactivation and\noperation;\n\u00b7              \nmaintenance and servicing\n\u00b7              \ngeneral safety instructions\nArticle 2.05\nInstallation of the sensor\nThe direction of installation in relation\nto the keel line shall be indicated on the rate-of-turn indicator's sensor\nunit. Installation instructions shall be provided to ensure maximum\ninsensitivity to other normal movements of the vessel.\nCHAPTER 3\nMINIMUM OPERATIONAL REQUIREMENTS FOR\nRATE-OF-TURN INDICATORS\nArticle 3.01\nOperational readiness of the rate-of-turn indicator\n1.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 From a cold start, the rate-of-turn indicator shall be\nfully operational within 4 minutes and shall operate to within the required\naccuracy tolerances.\n2.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 A warning signal shall indicate that the indicator is\nswitched on. It shall be possible to observe and operate the rate-of-turn\nindicator simultaneously.\n3.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Cordless remote controls shall not be permitted.\nArticle 3.02\nIndication of the rate of turn\n1.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 The rate of turn shall be indicated on a linear\ngraduated scale having the zero point situated in the middle. It shall be\npossible to read the direction and extent of the rate of turn with the\nnecessary accuracy. Indicators other than needle indicators and bar-graphs\nshall not be permitted.\n2.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 The indicator scale shall be at least 20 cm long\nand may be circular or rectilinear.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Rectilinear scales may be arranged horizontally only.\n3.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Solely digital indicators shall not be permitted.\nArticle 3.03\nMeasuring ranges\nRate-of-turn indicators may be provided\nwith one or more measuring ranges. The following measuring ranges are\nrecommended:\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 30\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 \u00b0/min\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 60\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 \u00b0/min\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 90\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 \u00b0/min\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 180\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 \u00b0/min\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 300\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 \u00b0/min.\nArticle 3.04\nAccuracy of the indicated rate of turn\nThe indicated rate of turn shall not differ\nby more than 2 % from the measurable maximum value or by more than\n10 % from the actual value; whichever is the greater (see Appendix).\nArticle 3.05\nSensitivity\nThe operating threshold shall be less than\nor equal to a change in angular speed equivalent to l % of the indicated\nvalue.\nArticle 3.06\nMonitoring of operation\n1.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 If the rate-of-turn indicator does not operate within\nthe required accuracy range, this shall be indicated.\n2.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 If a gyroscope is used, any critical fall in the rate\nof rotation of the gyroscope shall be signalled by an indicator. A critical\nfall in the rate of rotation of the gyroscope is one which lowers accuracy by\n10 %.\nArticle 3.07\nInsensitivity to normal movements of the vessel\n1.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Rolling of the vessel of up to 10\u00b0 at a rate of turn of\nup to 4\u00b0/s shall not give rise to measurement errors in excess of the\nstipulated tolerances.\n2.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Impacts such as those that may occur during berthing\nshall not give rise to measurement errors in excess of the stipulated\ntolerances.\nArticle 3.08\nInsensitivity to magnetic fields\nThe rate-of-turn indicator shall be\ninsensitive to magnetic fields which typically occur on board the vessel.\nArticle 3.09\nSlave indicators\nSlave indicators shall comply with all\nrequirements applicable to rate-of-turn indicators.\nCHAPTER 4\nMINIMUM\nTECHNICAL REQUIREMENTS \nFOR RATE-OF-TURN INDICATORS\nArticle 4.01\nOperation\n1.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 All controls shall be so arranged that during their\noperation no information is concealed from view and radar navigation remains\nunimpaired.\n2.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 All controls and indicators shall be provided with a\ndazzle-free source of lighting appropriate for all ambient lighting conditions\nand adjustable down to zero by means of an independent control.\n3.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Adjustment of controls shall be such that movements to\nthe right or upwards have a positive effect on the variable and movements to\nthe left or downwards a negative effect.\n4.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 If push-buttons are used, it shall be possible to\nlocate and operate them by touch. They shall also have clearly perceptible\ncontact release. If pushbuttons have multiple functions, it must be apparent\nwhich hierarchical level is active.\nArticle 4.02\nDamping devices\n1.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 The sensor system shall be damped for critical values.\nThe damping constant (63 % of the limit value) shall not exceed 0.4 s.\n2.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 The indicator shall be damped for critical values.\nControls for\nincreasing damping shall be permitted.\nUnder no\ncircumstances may the damping constant exceed 5 s.\nArticle 4.03\nConnection of additional equipment\n1.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 If the rate-of-turn indicator can be connected to slave\nindicators or similar equipment, the rate-of-turn indication shall remain\nusable as an analogue electric signal. In addition, the rate-of-turn indicator\nmay possess a digital interface in accordance with (2).\nThe rate of turn\nshall continue to be indicated with galvanic earth insulation and the\nequivalent to an analogue voltage of 20 mV/\u00b0/min\u00b1 5 % and a maximum\ninternal resistance of 100 \u2126.\nPolarity shall\nbe positive when the vessel is turning to starboard and negative when it is\nturning to port.\nThe operating\nthreshold shall not exceed 0.3\u00b0/min.\nZero error shall\nnot exceed 1\u00b0/min at temperatures from 0 to 40 \u00b0C.\nWith the\nindicator switched on and the sensor not exposed to the effects of movement,\nthe spurious voltage at the output signal measured with a 10 Hz pass-band\nlow-pass filter shall not exceed 10 mV.\nThe rate-of-turn\nsignal shall be received without additional damping beyond the limits referred\nto in Article 4.02 (1).\n2.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 A digital interface shall be designed pursuant to\nEuropean standards EN 61162-1: 2008, EN 61162-2: 1998 and EN 61162-3: 2008.\n3.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 An external alarm switch shall be provided. The switch\nshall be installed as a galvanic insulation break-switch for the indicator.\nThe external\nalarm shall be triggered by contact closure:\n\u00b7              \nif the rate-of-turn indicator is disconnected;\nor\n\u00b7              \nif the rate-of-turn indicator is not in\noperation; or\n\u00b7              \nif the operating control has reacted following\nan excessive error (Article 3.06\nCHAPTER 5\ntest conditions and procedures for rate-of-turn indicators\nArticle 5.01\nSafety, load capacity and electromagnetic compatibility\nPower supply, safety, mutual interference\nof ship borne equipment, compass safe distance, resistance to climatic\ninfluences, mechanical strength, environmental impact, audible noise emission\nand electromagnetic compatibility shall be tested in accordance with European\nStandard EN 60945:2002. \nArticle 5.02\nSpurious emissions\nSpurious emissions shall be measured in\naccordance with European Standard EN 60945:2002 in the frequency range of\n30 to 2000 MHz. \nThe requirements of Article 2.02 (2) shall\nbe met.\nArticle 5.03\nTest procedure\n1.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Rate-of-turn indicators shall be tested under nominal\nand boundary conditions. In this regard, the influence of the operating voltage\nand of the ambient temperature shall be tested as far as the prescribed limit\nvalue.\nIn addition,\nradio transmitters shall be used to set up the maximum magnetic fields in the\nvicinity of the indicators.\n2.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Under the conditions described in paragraph 1, indicator\nerrors shall remain within the tolerances indicated in the Annex. \n3.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 All minimum requirements of Chapters 2 to 4 shall be\nmet.\nAppendix\nFigure 1: Maximum tolerances for\nindication errors of rate-of-turn indicators\nPart III\nRequirements\nFor Installation And Performance Tests\nFor Radar Equipment And Rate-Of-Turn Indicators\nUsed On Board Inland Waterway Vessels\nTable\nof contents\nArticle 1 -\nGeneral\nArticle 2 -\nApproved specialised firms\nArticle 3 -\nRequirements for on-board power supply\nArticle 4 -\nInstallation of the radar antenna\nArticle 5 -\nInstallation of the display unit and the control unit\nArticle 6 -\nInstallation of the rate-of-turn indicator\nArticle 7 -\nInstallation of the position sensor\nArticle 8 -\nInstallation and performance test\nArticle 9 -\nInstallation and performance certificate\nArticle 1\nGeneral\n1.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Installation and performance tests of radar navigation\nequipment and rate-of-turn indicator systems must take place according to the\nfollowing provisions.\n2.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Only equipment approved with \na type approval\naccording to \n(aa) Part I\nArticle 6 or\n(bb) Part II\nArticle 1.05 \nor \n\u00b7              \napproved with a type approval recognised as\nequivalent according to Part VI\nand\n\u00b7              \nbearing a corresponding type approval number\nshall be\nauthorised for installation.\nArticle 2\nApproved specialised firms\n1.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 The installation, replacement, repair or maintenance of\nradar navigation equipment and rate-of-turn indicators shall be carried out\nonly by specialised firms approved by the competent authority. \n2.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Approval may be withdrawn by the competent authority.\n3.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 The competent authority shall immediately notify the other\ncompetent authorities of the specialised firms which it has approved.\nArticle 3\nRequirements for on-board power supply\nAll power supply leads for radar navigation\nequipment and rate-of-turn indicators shall have their own separate safety\ndevices and if possible be fail-safe.\nArticle 4\nInstallation of the radar antenna\n1.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 The radar antenna shall be installed as close as\npossible to the fore-and-aft-line. There shall be no obstruction in the\nvicinity of the antenna causing false echoes or unwanted shadows; if necessary,\nthe antenna shall be mounted on the forecastle. The mounting and attachment of\nthe radar antenna in its operational position shall be sufficiently stable to\nenable the radar navigation equipment to perform within the required accuracy\nlimits.\n2.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 After the angular error in the mounting has been\ncorrected and the equipment has been switched on, the difference between lubber\nline and fore-and-aft-line shall not be greater than 1 \u00b0.\nArticle 5\nInstallation of the display unit and the control unit\n1.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 The display unit and control unit shall be installed in\nthe wheelhouse in such a way that the evaluation of the radar image and the\noperation of the radar navigation equipment present no difficulty. The\nazimuthal orientation of the radar image shall be in accordance with the normal\nsituation of the surroundings. Holders and adjustable\nconsoles shall be constructed in a way that they can be fixed in each position\nfree of vibration.\n2.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 During radar navigation, artificial lighting shall not\nbe reflected in the direction of the radar operator.\n3.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 When the control unit is not part of the display unit,\nit shall be located in housing within 1 metre of the display unit. Cordless\nremote controls shall not be permitted.\n4.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 If slave indicators are installed, they shall satisfy\nthe requirements which apply to navigational radar equipment.\nArticle 6\nInstallation of the rate-of-turn indicator\n1.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 The rate-of-turn indicator shall be located ahead of\nthe helmsman and within their field of vision.\n2.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 The sensor system shall be installed as far as possible\namidships, horizontal and aligned with the ship's fore-and aft-line. The\ninstallation site shall as far as possible be free of vibration and be liable\nonly to modest temperature variations. The indicator unit shall if possible be\ninstalled directly above the radar display.\n3.\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 If slave indicators are installed, they shall satisfy\nthe requirements which apply to rate-of-turn indicators.\nArticle 7\nInstallation of the position sensor\nFor inland ECDIS equipment which is\noperated in navigation mode, the position sensor (e.g. DGPS antenna) must\nbe installed in such a way as to ensure that it operates with the greatest\npossible degree of accuracy and is not adversely affected by superstructures\nand transmitting equipment on board ship.\nArticle 8\nInstallation and performance test\nBefore the equipment is switched on for the\nfirst time after installation, or after renewals or extensions of the EU certificate\n(except according to Article 2.09 (2) of Annex II), as well as after each\nmodification of the vessel likely to affect the operating conditions of the\nequipment, an installation and performance test shall be carried out by the\ncompetent authority or the technical service designated by the competent\nauthority or by a firm authorised in accordance with Article 2. For this\npurpose, the following conditions shall be fulfilled:\nthe power supply\nshall have a separate safety device;\n\u00b7              \nthe operating voltage shall be within the\ntolerance\n\u00b7              \nthe cabling and its installation shall satisfy\nthe provisions of Annex II and, if applicable ADN; \n\u00b7              \nthe rate of antenna revolutions shall reach at\nleast 24 rpm\n\u00b7              \nthere shall be no obstruction in the vicinity of\nthe antenna which impairs navigation\n\u00b7              \nthe safety switch of the antenna, if provided,\nshall be in good working order\n\u00b7              \nthe arrangement of display units, rate-of-turn\nindicators and control units shall be ergonomic and user-friendly\n\u00b7              \nthe lubber line of the radar navigation equipment\nshall not deviate from the ship's fore-and-aft-line by more than 1 \n\u00b7              \nthe accuracy of the range and azimuthal displays\nshall satisfy the requirements (measurements using known targets\n\u00b7              \nlinearity in short ranges shall be correct\n(pushing and pulling\n\u00b7              \nthe displayed minimum range shall be\n15 metres or less\n\u00b7              \nthe centre of the picture shall be visible and\nits diameter shall not exceed 1 mm\n\u00b7              \nfalse echoes caused by reflections and unwanted\nshadows on the lubber line shall not occur or shall not impair the safety of navigation\n\u00b7              \nsea-clutter and rain-clutter suppressors (STC\nand FTC preset) and the associated controls shall perform correctly\n\u00b7              \nthe gain adjustment shall be in proper working\norder\n\u00b7              \nfocus and picture definition shall be correct\n\u00b7              \nthe ship's turning direction shall be as\nindicated on the rate-of-turn indicator and the zero position at dead ahead\nshall be correct\n\u00b7              \nthe radar navigation equipment shall not be\nsensitive to transmissions by the ship's radio equipment or to interference\nfrom other on-board sources\n\u00b7              \nthe radar navigation equipment or rate-of-turn\nindicator shall not interfere with other on-board equipment\nFurthermore, in the case of inland ECDIS\nequipment:\n\u00b7              \nthe statistical positional error affecting the\nchart shall not exceed 2 m\n\u00b7              \nthe statistical phase angle error affecting the\nchart shall not exceed 1 \nArticle 9\nInstallation and performance certificate\nAfter successful completion of a test in\naccordance with Article 8, the competent authority, the technical service\nor the approved firm shall issue a certificate based on the model according to\nPart IV. This certificate shall be kept permanently on board.\nIf the test conditions have not been met, a\nlist of defects shall be drawn up. Any existing certificate shall be withdrawn\nor sent to the competent authority by the technical service or the approved\nfirm.\nPart IV\n(model)\nInstallation And Performance Certificate\nFor Radar Navigation Installations And Rate-Of-Turn Indicators Used On Board\nInland Waterway Vessels\nVessel name/type:\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 VI\nEquivalent equipment\nRadar navigation equipment: Type approvals\nbased on Resolution 1989-II-33 of the Central Commission for the Navigation on\nthe Rhine of 19 May 1989 last amended by Resolution 2008-II-11 of 27. November\n2008*\n\u00b7              \nRate of turn indicators: Type approvals based on\nResolution 1989-II-34 of the Central Commission for the Navigation on the Rhine\nof 19 May 1989 last amended by Resolution 2008-II-11 of 27 November 2008*\n\u00b7              \nRadar navigation equipment and Rate of turn\nindicators installed and functioning conform Resolution 1989-II-35 of the\nCentral Commission for the Navigation on the Rhine of 19 May 1989 last amended\nby Resolution 2008-II-11of 27 November 2008*\n(*)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Requirements for the\ninstallation and functioning of radar navigation equipment and rate of turn\nindicators for the navigation on the Rhine.\n[1]\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 In the case of vessels whose\nhome port is elsewhere, account is to be taken of Article 32 of the Ems-Dollart\nTreaty of 8 April 1960 (BGBl. 1963 II, p. 602).\n[2]\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 OJ L 59, 27.2.1998, p. 1.\n[3]\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Alternative type-approvals\nrecognised pursuant to Directive 97/68/EC are listed in Annex XII, \u00a7.2 of\nDirective 97/68/EC.\n[4]\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Where appliances or panels do\nnot have this type of protection their location shall meet the conditions\napplying to that type of protection.\n[5]\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Where appliances release\nlarge amounts of heat: IP 12.\n[6]\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Where appliances or panels do\nnot have this type of protection their location shall meet the conditions\napplying to that type of protection.\n[7]\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Electrical equipment of the certified safety type as\nin accordance with\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 (a) European\nstandards EN 50014: 1997; 50015: 1998; 50016: 2002; 50017: 1998; 50018: 2000;\n50019: 2000 and 50020: 2002;\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 or\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 (b) IEC publication\n60079 as of 1 October 2003. \n[8]\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Where that voltage comes from\nhigher-voltage networks galvanic separation shall be used (safety transformer).\n[9]\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Where that voltage comes from\nhigher-voltage networks galvanic separation shall be used (safety transformer).\n[10]\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 All of the poles of the\nsecondary circuit shall be insulated from the earth.\n[11]\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Where that voltage comes from\nhigher-voltage networks galvanic separation shall be used (safety transformer).\n[12]\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Where that voltage comes from\nhigher-voltage networks galvanic separation shall be used (safety transformer).\n[13]\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Distance from the cross-tree to\nthe deck.\n[14]\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Total length of the topmast,\nwithout the masthead.\n[15]\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Diameter of the topmast at the\nlevel of the masthead fitting.\n[16]\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Total length of the bowsprit.\n[17]\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Total length of the jib-boom.\n[18]\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Total length of the main boom.\n[19]\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Total length of the gaff.\n[20]\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Distance from the top or\ncross-tree to the deck.\n[21]\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Distance from the top or\ncross-tree to the deck.\n[22]\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 OJ L 207, 23.7.1998, p. 1.\nDirective as amended by Directive 98/79/EC (OJ L 331, 7.12.1998, p. 1).\n[23]\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 OJ L 164, 30.6.1994, p. 15.\nDirective as last amended by Regulation (EC) No 1882/2003.\n[24]\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 The hold sections providing\nfree surfaces that are exposed to water arise from the longitudinal and/or\ntranverse water-tight compartmentalisation that forms independent sections.\n[25]\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 The hold sections providing\nfree surfaces that are exposed to water arise from the longitudinal and/or\ntranverse water-tight compartmentalisation that forms independent sections.\n[26]\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 1. Permanent CO2\nfire-fighting systems installed before 1 October 1980 may remain in use until\nthe issue or renewal of the Community certificate after 1 January 2035, if they\ncomply with the requirements of Article 7.03(5) of the Rhine Vessel Inspection\nRegulation in force on 1 April 1976.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 2. Permanent CO2\nfire-fighting systems installed between 1 April 1992 and 31 December 1994 may\nremain in use until the issue or renewal of the Community certificate after 1\nJanuary 2035, if they comply with the requirements of Article 7.03(5) of the\nRhine Vessel Inspection Regulation in force on 31 December 1994.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 3. Recommendations of\nthe CCNR issued between 1 April 1992 and 31 December 1994 with regard to\nArticle 7.03(5) of the Rhine Vessel Inspection Regulation in force on 31\nDecember 1994 remain valid until the issue or renewal of the Community\ncertificate after 1 January 2035.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 4. Article\n10.03b(2)(a) is only applicable until the issue or renewal of the Community\ncertificate after 1 January 2035 if those installations have been installed in\nvessels laid down after 1 October 1992. \n[27]\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 1. Permanent CO2\nfire-fighting systems installed between 1 January 1995 and 31 March 2003 remain\nauthorised until the issue or renewal of the Community certificate after 1\nJanuary 2035 if they comply with Article 10.03(5), of the Rhine Vessel\nInspection Regulation as applicable on 31 March 2002.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 2. Recommendations of\nthe Central Commission for Navigation on the Rhine issued between 1 January\n1995 and 31 March 2002 regarding Article 10.03(5), of the Rhine Vessel\nInspection Regulation as applicable on 31 March 2002 remain valid until the\nissue or renewal of the Community certificate after 1 January 2035.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 3. Article\n10.05(2)(a), is applicable until the issue or renewal of the Community\ncertificate after 1 January 2035 only if those systems have been installed in\nvessels laid down after 1 October 1992. \n[28]\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 In accordance with Annex I,\nsection 1A(ii) of Directive 2004/26/EC, amending Directive 97/68/EC, the limits\nfor these date of entry into force of this Directive and to vessels in service\nwith the following proviso:\nThe requirements of Article 11.04\nmust be complied with where the entire hold area is renewed.\nWhere a conversion modifying the\nclear width of the side deck covers the entire length of the side decks,\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 (a) Article 11.04\nmust be complied with if the clear width of the side deck before the conversion\nto a height of 0,90 m, or the clear width above that height is to be reduced,\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 (b) the clear width\nof the side deck before the conversion, to a height of 0,90 m, or the clear\nwidth above that height must not be lower than the measurements indicated in\nArticle 11.04. values laid\ndown in the RVIR apply with effect from 1 July 2007.\n[67]\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Applies only for engines with\nrated power output more than 560 kW.\n[68]\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 The stage II limit values laid\ndown in the RVIR apply with effect from 1 July 2007.\n[69]\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Applies only for engines with\nrated power output more than 560 kW.\n[70]\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 The stage II limit values laid\ndown in the RVIR apply with effect from 1 July 2007.\n[71]\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Operating phases\nThe following operating phases shall\nbe defined for testing:\n(a)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Stand-by operation is\nwhen the on-board sewage treatment plant is running but has not been fed with\nsewage for more than a day. An on-board sewage treatment plant may be in\nstand-by operation when, for example, the passenger vessel is not in service\nfor an extended period and sits idle at its mooring. \n(b)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Emergency operation is\nwhen individual subassemblies of an on-board sewage treatment plant have malfunctioned,\nso that the sewage cannot be treated as intended.\n(c)\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 Run\u2011down,\nstandstill and restart operation is when an on-board sewage treatment plant is\ntaken out of service for an extended period (winter mooring) and the power\nsupply is switched off, or when the on\u2011board sewage treatment plant is\nstarted up again at the beginning of the season.\n[72]\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 specify as appropriate.\n[73]\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 specify as appropriate\n[74]\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 In case tests are made by the competent authority mark\n\"not relevant\"\n[75]\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 specify as appropriate\n[76]\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 In case of more test cycles indicate for each cycle\n[77]\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 No limit values exist for the inflow\n[78]\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 To include by tester\n[79]\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 specify as appropriate.\n[80]\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 No limit values exist for the inflow\nANNEX\nto the proposal for a\nDIRECTIVE OF THE EUROPEAN\nPARLIAMENT AND OF THE COUNCIL\nlaying down technical requirements\nfor inland waterway vessels and repealing Directive 2006/87/EC of the European\nParliament and of the Council \nLIST OF ANNEXES\nAnnex III Subjects for possible additional\ntechnical requirements applicable to craft on inland waterways of Zones 1 and 2\nAnnex IV Subjects for possible reductions\nof the technical requirements applicable to craft on inland waterways of Zones\n3 and 4\nAnnex V Model Union inland navigation\ncertificates\nAnnex VI Model register of Union inland\nnavigation certificates\nAnnex VII Classification societies\nANNEX III\nSUBJECTS FOR POSSIBLE ADDITIONAL\nTECHNICAL REQUIREMENTS APPLICABLE TO CRAFT ON INLAND WATERWAYS OF ZONES 1 AND 2\nAny additional technical requirements\nadopted by a Member State under Article 5(1) of this Directive for craft operating\non Zones 1 and/or 2 of that Member State's territory are limited to the\nfollowing subjects:\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 1. Definitions\n\u2013              \nNecessary for understanding the additional\nrequirements\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 2. Stability\n\u2013              \nStructure reinforcement\n\u2013              \nCertificate/attestation by an approved\nClassification Society\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 3. Safety clearance and\nfreeboard\n\u2013              \nFreeboard\n\u2013              \nSafety clearance\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 4. Watertightness of hull\nopenings and superstructures\n\u2013              \nSuperstructures\n\u2013              \nDoors\n\u2013              \nWindows and skylights\n\u2013              \nHold hatches\n\u2013              \nOther openings (ventilation pipes, exhaust\npipes, etc.)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 5. Equipment\n\u2013              \nAnchors and anchor chains\n\u2013              \nNavigation lights\n\u2013              \nSound signals\n\u2013              \nCompass\n\u2013              \nRadar\n\u2013              \nTransmitting and receiving installations\n\u2013              \nLife-saving equipment\n\u2013              \nAvailability of nautical charts\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 6. Additional provisions for\npassenger vessels\n\u2013              \nStability (wind strength, criteria)\n\u2013              \nLife-saving equipment\n\u2013              \nFreeboard\n\u2013              \nSafety clearance\n\u2013              \nWheelhouse visibility\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 7. Convoys and container\ntransport\n\u2013              \nPusher connection craft-lighter\n\u2013              \nStability of craft or lighters carrying\ncontainers\nANNEX IV\nSUBJECTS FOR POSSIBLE REDUCTIONS OF\nTHE TECHNICAL REQUIREMENTS APPLICABLE TO CRAFT ON INLAND WATERWAYS OF ZONES 3\nAND 4\nAny reduced technical requirements allowed\nby a Member State under Article 5(7) of this Directive for vessels operating\nexclusively on Zone 3 or Zone 4 waterways on the territory of that Member State\nare restricted to the following subjects:\nZone 3\n\u2013                        \nAnchor equipment, including length of anchor\nchains\n\u2013                        \n(Forward) speed\n\u2013                        \nCollective life-saving appliances\n\u2013                        \nTwo-compartment status\n\u2013                        \nWheelhouse visibility\nZone 4\n\u2013                        \nAnchor equipment, including length of anchor\nchains\n\u2013                        \n(Forward) speed\n\u2013                        \nLife-saving appliances\n\u2013                        \nTwo-compartment status\n\u2013                        \nWheelhouse visibility\n\u2013                        \nSecond independent propulsion system\nANNEX V\nMODEL\nUnion INLAND NAVIGATION CERTIFICATES\nPart\nI\nMODEL\nUnion INLAND NAVIGATION CERTIFICATE\n\nUNION INLAND NAVIGATION CERTIFICATE\n(Reserved for State emblem)\nNAME OF STATE \nCERTIFICATE No .................................................................................................................. \nPlace, date ................................................................................. \u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 \u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026\u2026. \u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0 (Signature) _________________ (1) Delete where inapplicable. \u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0
